Y'know what, thats fine, maybe you havent grown up, but I have.
Dead leg!! (kicks him in the thigh.)

No! Listen, Im not gonna go through this with you again, okay. Just once I wanna beat when you cant blame it on the broken nose, the buzzer, or the fact that you thought you were getting mono. Lets just call this, tie score and its halftime.
Y'know what? Ill think youll play.
Because the winner gets this!
When Mom and Dad drove you to the hospital to get your nose fixed, I swam into the lake and fished it out.
No its not! You want it, youre gonna have to win it!
Come on Phoebe, lets go! Come on, its time to get serious, huddle up. Joey, keep your head in the game.
All right look, if I take Chandler out of the running will you be able to focus?
All right, you just make sure that Chandler catches the ball, Ill take care of the rest.
Break!
Whoa! Whoa!! Tackled by a girl! Bet ya dont see that everyday, do ya?
What?! I just touched him and he went over.
Forty-two to twenty-one! Like the turkey, Ross is done!
Youre so pathetic! Why cant you just accept it, were winning because Im better than you.
Oh, what a great argument, exhaling! All right, y'know what, Ill prove it to you, okay. Ill trade you Joey for Rachel, and Ill still win the game.
Oh, then bring it on! Oh, unless of course your afraid you might lose to a bunch of girls.
Come on Rach, come on. Lets see whats it like to be on a winning team for a change.
All right then.
Are we playing football or what? Come on you hairy-backed Marries.
We have to do this. We are playing for women everywhere. Okay, just think about every lousy date that you ever had, okay, every guy who kept on the TV while youre making out...
Come on, okay, come on this is for all womankind. Lets kill um!

All right, we still have a minute and a half to go, and were down by two points. Two points.... (she gets interrupted by the guys, who are doing a slow-motion high five.) Phoebe you do a button-hook again. Rachel, you go long.
Honey, theres a reason.
All right Rachel, you sweep behind, Ill pitch it to you, you throw it down field to Phoebe. All right. Break.
Thirty-two! Seventy-one! Hike!
No! Im not okay!
Come on! Come on! Hurry! Were running out of time! Huddle up!
All right, Phoebe get open. Rachel, go long.
Break!
Let go! Im a tiny little woman!!
Ow!!
Let go!
No!
I dont know. I guess the other people just dont care enough.
Let go!
You broke a little girls leg?!!
Maybe a Hello Kitty doll, the ability to walk...

All right, Ill take one box of the mint treasures, just one, and thats it. I-I started gaining weight after I joined the Brown Birds. (to Ross) Remember, how Dad bought all my boxes and I ate them all?
No.
Dont, dont, dont, dont, dont do this.
(she reaches out for it and stops) Oh God! I gotta go! (runs out)
(comes up and starts looking through Rosss cookie supply) Ross, but me down for another box of the mint treasures, okay. Where, where are the mint treasures?
What?
No. No, just, just, just a couple more boxes. It-it-its no big deal, all right, Im-Im cool. You gotta help me out with a couple more boxes!
(covers her neck) Oh God! (runs to the bathroom)
Christmas cookie?
(entering) Hey, guys. Im here to pick out my Christmas tree.
Is this the one that I threw out last year?
Oh honey, is that cause your Mom died around Christmas?
Oh. (turns and looks at Joey, who gives a way-to-go thumbs up and smile.)
Um-mm.
Wow. Joey, (sarcastically) how do you do it?
He took up the carpet, and now you can hear everything.
I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there to yell and then I end up apologizing to him.
All right, be my guest.
Honey, whats the matter?
Its Joeys birthday.
Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.
I know honey, Im sorry.
(gives her a look) Gee, I dont know Rach. Order up!! I got a Yentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!
Hey Gunther. Hi. (to Phoebe) I mean youre going out on a date with the noisy guy upstairs?
I know, hes too charming, but if you two start going out, then its just gonna make it so much harder for me to hate him.
Joey, where are the Jell-o shots?
(to Chandler) Stick out your tongue.
Oh my!!
How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joeys sisters.
Hi.
Isnt that great?
Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, y'know what, when he left I actually used the phrase, Hummina-hummina-hummina. (walks away)
How ya feelin?
What is the worse part?
Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, hes actually going to kill you dead.
I mean, was it Gina?
No, no, no, thats Dina.
That was me.
Thats okay.
Y'know which one was she again?
No honey, Im sorry, but the weekends not over yet.
I guess theyre back from their date.
Oh my God!
I am good. I finished my book.
I dont remember. Do you wanna take a walk?
Wait a minute, why dont you just call Mark. (they both look up in shock) I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, youve got to make stuff happen.
(to Ross) Honey, its not pushy, he gave her his home number.
Yay!
Oh, that is amazing!
What?
Are you crazy?!

What?! Ross y'know this isnt even about you! I mean this is about Rachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if youre right, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?
I mean dont you trust her?
Then get over yourself! Grow up!
So ah, Phoebe, how was your date?
Yeah, I do know.
Y'know if its any consolation, he really did sound like he was having more fun with you. (Rachel nods in agreement)
Please, I'm not going for anything.
Would you please go?
Look Julio, someone left their book here.
Oh yeah, what are you reading?
Have I read it? (pause) No, are you enjoying it?
Your a poet and don't know it. (she turns away and makes a face like 'I can't believe I just said that.')
Oh, then you do know it. (pause) So um what kind of things do you write about?
Mine? (points to her lower lip) Right here?
How would that go? (they kiss) Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.
(entering) Hi!
It was soo amazing, he is so sexy, and smart, which makes him even sexier. Oh gosh, I gotta so you this. Last night, we were fooling around and he stops to write a poem.
Anyway um, when he left he forgot to take the poem with him. Now, I am like totally dense about poetry, but I think it's pretty good all right. Check it out. (hands them the poem)
Oh good, I think so too. Pheebs?
Oh, I'm so glad you guys like it. Yay! All right I gotta go to work. (tries to take the poem)
All right, just give it back to me when your done. See you guys.
Hey.
Oh-ho, look what I got Julio.
Yeah, just like the one in the poem.
What do you mean?
(to Julio) So! I'm just an empty vase, huh?

Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else. And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y'know but that does not mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no right to make that kind of judgment about me.
You don't even know me...
What?
I'm sorry, my friend Phoebe...
(sarcastically) Oh yeah.
(to clerk) Hi.
Six? I just had it for one night. Its three.
Y'know in a weird way, you have too much power. Look, youre gonna have to help me out here, cause I only have three.
Oh my God. Richard? (turns around) Hi!
Wow! Your lip went bald. (Richard pays the clerk) Hey, thanks.
Right.
What?
(removes them) Thats because I-I was just grabbing some things out of the dryer, and its static cling. Or maybe its just that God knew Id be running into you and saw an opportunity.
Its good to see you too.
You see that guy? Hes in classics now, but y'know as soon as we leave hes going straight to the porn.
Yeah.
Me too.
Oh, um, I dont know if thats a good idea.
No, I just I think that its too soon.
(entering from her bedroom) Morning.
Yeah well, I ran into Richard.
Oh, um, around 8:02. We ah, talked for a little while, and then um, we went out for an innocent burger.
Tomorrow night.
Its not a date, okay. Im just gonna teach him how to make lasagne for some pot luck dinner he has.
Were not gonna have sex! Okay, nothings changed here. He still doesnt want children and I still do, so thats why were just gonna be friends.
You say Thank you very much, and then you buy me something pretty. Come on, were gonna put are hands in this bowl, and were gonna start squishing the tomatoes.
You touch peoples eyeballs every day and this feels weird.
Oops.
Gotta keep squishing.
Okay.
Oh, gosh, you got some on your shirt.
Hold on a second, just put a little club soda on it (does so) and it should umm, be.....
Umm, youve got some on your pants.

So, howd the lasagne go over? (listens) Really?! Good. So you owe me three pretty things. (listens) Yeah, Ive been thinking a lot about you too. (listens) I know. Its hard this whole platonic thing. (listens) Its a word!
Yeah, I do think its better this way. (listens) Yeah, were being smart. (gets up to answer the door) (listens) Yes, Im sure.(she opens the door and its Richard)
Ill call you back. (starts kissing him)
So we can be friends who sleep together.
Sounds smart and healthy to me. So um, just out of curiosity, um, do you currently have any other racquetball buddies?
Oh.
No! (pushes him) No!
Cause if you do that means youd be cancelling it for me, and were just friends.
Hi.
You would not believe my day! I had to work two shifts, and then to top it off, I lost one of my fake boobs, (opens her coat revealing a large burn mark over her left breast.) in a grill fire.
What are you smiling at?
Yeah, right.
I love this friend thing!
Ow!
Oh my God! Oh my God! (She frantically tries to clean up the bedroom as Richard starts the tour.)
(still hiding under the blankets) So um, who was she?
(still hiding under the blankets) Did you like her? And Im just asking as a friend, because I am totally fine with this.

(gets up) Okay, y'know what, Im not fine, Im not. I mean how can I be fine, hearing you come in with her, she wants to see your bedroom.... (pause) Y'know what, what if were friends who dont see other people?

Why not?! I mean this has been the most amazing week. Would it be so terrible? Even if we were friends who lived together. Or, maybe someday friends who stood up in front of their other friends, and vowed to be friends forever.
Thats not true, you dont have a moustache.
Y'know what, Ive got to walk out of here right now, cause getting over you is the hardest thing that I have ever had to do. I dont think I could do it again.
How bout one last game of racquetball?
Watch the thorns!
(to Phoebe) Look at you. All jealous.
Yeah, sure.
Y'know those are a delicacy in India.
Wow, she must have hurt you pretty bad, huh?
Oh, you two must have been so cute running around on a barge.
No, umm, he met some girl at the coffee house.
Yeah, Ginger something.
No, it was Ginger. I remember, because when he told me, I said, (singing) the movie star.
Well, what did you do?
Y'know what, dont tell us. Well just wait until Chandler gets home, (to Phoebe) because itll be more fun that way.
You gave her food poisoning!?
Oh my God! Joey, what did you do after you threw her leg on the fire?
Y'know they say a watched pot never beeps.
Phoebe why dont you just call her? You obviously want to.
Well, dont cha wanna?
Okay, well I do know you.
Well so?
(entering) Hi!
Oh, can I borrow this? (points to his milk) My milks gone bad.
So umm, how was your date with Ginger?
Sounds like shes got the ah, whole package.
Uh-huh.
Sorry, Pheebs.
Wed love too.
Wow! Its like Rachel in High School.
Come on! Come on, I was kidding! It was such an obvious joke!
I wont give you anything, but youll owe me 2.95.
Why? (in a motherlike tone) Do you have a report due?
Okay, lets start with the free messages outside the UN.
Wow! You might just get the first Nobel prize in rubbing. So what country is this guy from?
Wheres that?
I dont have an atlas.
Oh, but wait I do have a globe.
Hold on.
Kay, here you go. (Hands her this tiny little globe.)
Its a globe and, a pencil sharpener.
Oh, no thanks.
Well, if you dont have anything to copy, why are you going down there?
Wow! Its small.
So you had fun, huh?
No.
Oh no, shes still at work, but she told me to tell you to call her.
All right ah, Ross, this is the extent of my knowledge on the subject. (holds up a notepad) Call Rachel.
Oh thats my doodle of a ladybug, with a top hat. (to Phoebe) Shes fancy.
Yeah, well kinda cute, like really kinda cute, or kinda cute like your friend Spackel Back Larry?
Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir? (Mischa laughs) Why? What did I say?
Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.
Im also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.
Well, I was having a conversation.
What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a conversation?
Oh. (to Phoebe) Can I have a tissue?
Hey, the mans dog just died.
It will be my pleasure. (to Phoebe) My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your guy cant even say coupons. (they leave)
Hey.
Hows the big anniversary dinner?
Ohhh, nice.
What?! (She accidentally starts the blender without the lid on it and fruit flies everywhere.)
Thats okay, this is more important than fruit (pause) (angrily) on my ceiling! You broke up?!
Oh no!!
Rachel, you and Mark?!
Hey.
Oh, theres banana on it.
So then you know? (Phoebe nods her head)
Oh, good. Thanks.

Okay, all right dont judge me to much. Okay? Um, but I saw this info-mercial, and um, I swear to you I have never-ever bought anything on TV before, except for this mop. But there was this stuff on leg waxing, it just, it looked so amazing....
Yes! Have you seen it?
I know!!
Hello! Organic substances recently discovered in the depths of the rain forest!
Did that!
Okay. (Does so.) Ow!!!!! Ow-oh-oh!
No. It was painful. Oh my God , they should call it Pain-zine, now with a little wax.
Thats because their nerves are probably deadened from being so stupid. But hey, y'know if you dont believe me, please, by my guest.
Now, are you glad we didnt start with the bikini strips?
Ow!
Ow!! Ow!!
Its okay, its okay.
We were just waxing our legs.
Thats right.
What?
(going over to listen at the door) Rachel said everything was okay.
Oh my God.
Oh!! (hits Chandler and Joey in the head) You guys knew about this and you didnt tell us?!
(stopping him) What, what are you doing? You cant go out there.
Because theyll know weve been listening.
What if they dont?
Hey. Its three in the morning. They dont know that Ive come home yet. You notice how neither one of them are wondering where I am.
Guys. I thought you were taking Ross to the game?
No! Rachel is meeting us here.
Its never taken you more than a shower to get over a relationship.
(seeing her) Okay, lets go!! Lets hit the road!!
Lets get the show on it!
Oh Rachel, I know the best coffee house and its sooo close.
Were sorry honey.
Very bad.
Chandler!!
Werent you nine?!
Were really sorry, but um, she did ask us first.
Noo! Ill stay. Hes my brother.
No! Were gonna have fun. We can make fudge!
Why? Do you think hes still mad at us?
No Chandler no! No unscheduled stops. You can go when we stop for gas.
What?
Ow!
(getting out) No, Rachel never pees in public restrooms.
So, if youre parents hadnt got divorced, youd be able to answer a question like a normal person?
What?!
Please!!
These tiny, little non-breasts?! Please, its gotta be Rachel.
All right then, your bra would still be big.
Chandler!!
Freemont. West-Westmont, ah Westburg?
Who? I mean have you seen a car come by here in the last hour and a half? I think we should call Ross, maybe he can get a car and come pick us up.
So the going for help went well?
Then why are you smoking?
(running over to stop Rachel) Hey Rach, the tampons here are only a penny. Lets stock up. (takes her into the bathroom)
(reading the sign) Whats pleh?
Huh. Whats doofus spelled backwards?
I know, what about Rachel? I mean how are we even gonna ask her?
Umm, if ah, it might be okay if Ross came skiing?
Here we go again.
(shyly) I dont know.
What I said was, was that I understood. Joeys the one who agreed with you!
All right, well call you when we get back.
(to Joey) Whats so funny?
Oh. (she laughs)
Yeah, ah, but Pheebs dont you think hes a little young to get married?
So, um, how-how did you guys meet?
And y'know what, I just realised, in the last year Ive only gone out with two guys, Richard and Julio. You gotta help me out here, you gotta set me up, you gotta get me back in the game.
(to a customer) Pete, can I get you something else?
Havent you and I covered that topic?
Aww, the only reason you want to go out with me because my blond wig, and the big boobs, and the fact that I serve you food.
I mean really, think about it.
Nah, he doesnt do anything for me.
Well, umm, Walker was looking for this big bus load of kids. (realises) All right, I get your point.
Hey.
Uh, yeah.
Here you go.
As a joke, this customer at work who has a crush on me gave me a $20,000 tip. His number is on the check, he just did so Id call him.
Thats Bill Clinton.
Oh my God! Thats Pete! But why is Bill huggin Pete?
Im not gonna go out with him.
Or incredibly offensive.
What the hell is this? (holding up the check)
Seriously, what is this supposed to mean?
Youre supposed to double the tax. Not double the tax of Romania. I mean, whats-whats the deal? Are you, are you trying to buy me? Is this the way you get girls to go out with you?
What?!
Okay, umm, youre a loon.
I dont know.
Cause I dont want to encourage this kind of behaviour.
Guys, please, Im just gonna have dinner with him. Okay?
I know!!
(opening the door) (to Pete) Hey!
And thats why, Im not inviting you in for a drink. (starts to leave) Bye.
(in the hallway) So, where do you want to go?
Oh, thats sounds great.
Oh come on, its only fair, you paid for the flight. Now is, is that enough lire?
Why, how much is that?
Oh, this is so great.
All right then. (He leans in to kiss her goodnight, but she quickly kisses him on the cheek and pats his shoulder.) Bye.
Hello, people who do not live here.
I gave you a key for emergencies!
Hes great! I mean we have such a good time together! Hes so funny, and sooo sweet, and Im not attracted to him at all!!
Noo!! Its driving me crazy. I mean every other way hes like the perfect guy, he has everything. Plus! He actually has everything.
Two.

Absolutely! (He goes to kiss her, but she stops him and rubs his head and says...) Now get out of here you!! (Pete leaves) (to the gang) Okay, Im running out of places I can touch him! Look, is there something wrong with me? I mean why am I only attracted to guys where theres no future? Either theyre too old, or theyre too young, and then theres Pete whos-whos crazy about me, and whos absolutely perfect for me, and theres like zip going on! I mean, seriously, does it sound like somethings wrong with me?!
Sure.
(looks around) Well, with all these doctors and nurses, Im gonna say, midget rodeo.
Okay. Umm, y'know, I dont think, I dont think I told you this, but umm, I just got out of a really serious relationship.
So I did tell you. Okay, y'know, that really isnt the thing. Umm, the thing is that, right now Im just in a place in my life where I need to focus on me. Y'know what I mean?
I so wanna be attracted to you.
Im sorry.
Its not?
Well, um, look I-I dont want this to come our wrong, but ah, you seem awfully confident for a guy I just told I wasnt attracted too.
Hey, Rach, how was work?
By the way, Ross dropped by a box of your stuff.
Something wrong?
Wow, youre really crazy about her, huh?
Yes!! Yes! Yeah, yeah, yeah!
Oh, she was a cruel, cranky, old bitch! (Ross gives her a look) (to Ross) And Im sorry she died. Did Dad say I get the dollhouse?
I get the dollhouse!
Y'know what, you can play with my dollhouse.
Any time you want. Y'know, when I was younger, all I wanted to do was to play with this dollhouse, but no!! It was to be looked at, but never played with.
Look at it! Ohhh! Wallpapers a little faded, thats okay. Carpets a little loose. Hardwood floors!!
I know!!!
Okay.
Whats this?
Not one that can pee on the roof.
I dont want a ghost.
Okay, Phoebe, y'know what? That-thats it, thats it, all right? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? Theyre not the right size, theyre not Victorian, and they just dont go.
Its very interesting, Phoebe.
Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!
Youre kidding?! Thats great!
Oh my.
Come on Rach, when a guy says hes going to call, it doesnt mean hes going to call. Hasnt it ever happened to you?
Hmm, bite me.
(from the bathroom) Im in the shower!
Oh, thats okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower massager.
(runs over to her) I tried to reach you at work. Theres....been a fire.
Well, the giraffes okay. And so is the pirate.
Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.
That was you?!
Hi! Hey, Pete youre back! Hey, check this out. (She starts to skate over to him)
Wow! Youre a lot sturdier that Chandler. He crumpled like a piece of paper. So how was youre trip?
Oh, whatd ya bring me?! (She opens the gift) Awww, hotel toiletries from Japan. Oh, these are gonna go in my permanent collection. You want some coffee?
(popping back up) Regular or decaf?
Okay. (hands him a cup)
So what did you do today Pete?
What?! Oh.(She turns around quickly and falls)
Can you believe he just offered me a restaurant?

I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven and opened Easy Monicas Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. (She removes her fake breasts) But Petes just doing this because he has a crush on me.
Hmm, no. I mean how can I accept a restaurant from him? I-I-I-I cant. I couldnt even accept a necklace from Stu Vincent in the seventh grade.
Oh, please.
What? Honey.
Oh God, Im so sorry.
Oh God!
Oh absolutely. I like it even more on you than I did on Colonel Sanders. (Ross starts to leave) Ross! Ross! Im kidding!
What-what was it you were gonna tell us?
Okay. Heres the thing.
I cant do it. Im sorry, I wish I could, but umm, see you have these feelings for me....
Huh?
Oh?
Oh, thats great! I mean Im-Im sorry, but Im so happy for you. And now I can work for you!
Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! (she rolls over and kisses him on the cheek) All right, y'know what? Im just gonna roll right into that office and-and quit!
Okay. (she gets ready to go) Can you give me a little push?

(rolling towards the office) Im quitting!! Woo-hoo! (She rolls through a doorway and out of sight. We then hear a big crash, and see Monica roll past the door the other way.) Im okay!! Im all right!!
Hey!
Hey, guess what Im doing tonight.
Im checking out the restaurant with Pete.
I know.
What?
Okay, but wouldnt it be easier if you had to tell me something that you could tell me.
Okay. Does it have to do with Ross and Rachel?
Does it have to do with Joey?
Does it have to do with-with Chandler and that sock that he keeps by his bed?
Does it involve travel?
Does it involve clogs?
Clogs.
Claws?!
Okay, so it doesnt involve Ross or Rachel or Chandler or Joey. But, what about Pete?
What is it?! What about Pete?
Okay, I feel like Im talking to Lassie. All right, Phoebe would you just tell me!
Okay, I gotta go. (gets up)
Okay, does it involve something to do with Petes computer company?

I dont believe this! Wow, look at this refrigerator! Its gigantic! I mean I could live in this thing! Id be cold, but Im always cold. Oh my God, look at these spider burners! I love spider burners.
Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much. (runs over and hugs him)
Did you just smell my hair?
Oh God.
You still have feelings for me dont you?
Pete.
No, its not bad. Its not bad at all. Its-its really nice.
You may be okay about getting hurt, but I am not okay with being the one who hurts you. Thats why I cant take this job.
And well, we probably shouldnt see each other anymore. Im sorry.
Okay, bye.
All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. (She kisses him back on the lips) Oh, wow! (They then hug and kiss, very passionately.)
I need two. Im bringing Pete. My boyfriend. I have a boyfriend now!
Really? Whos number two?
Bye-bye!
Joey, what are you doing?! Its never gonna happen, shes seeing somebody.
(to Phoebe) Here you go. You can wear this. (hands her a sweater)
Uh-huh.
Phoebe?
All right. Honey, thats-thats a sleeve. Okay?
And! We also have speaker phone. (She turns on the speaker phone.)
Okay, wait, you gotta hang up cause were gonna be late.
Of course not.
Theres our star!
Hi!
Yeah, and in the long version, I dump him for telling people the short version.
Hey!
Yeah. Where were you?
You were the next caller five hours ago. You must be going crazy.
(entering from her bedroom) Pheebs, youve been up for 24 hours! Go to sleep, honey. Th-this isnt healthy.

Come on Chandler, come on, I can handle Ross. (They go to the door. Ross is trying to stick his hand through and undo the chain; Monica pushes his hand back.) (To Ross) Hold on! (She opens the door.) Hey Ross. What's up bro?
I'm so sorry that you had to find out this way. I'm sorry, but it's true, I love him too.
Guys, you're a few steps ahead of us.
But what?
In that cute, little, sweet way she just did?
I know what you need, you need a bodyguard. Hey Ross, what is Ben doing after preschool?
Isn't this great?
Couldn't you just stay like this forever? (His eyes snap open.) Chandler! Couldn't you just stay here forever?
Are you okay?
What-what are you doing?
Man, I knew it! I knew you were going to do this!!
Get all freaked out because everybody was talking and just joking around about marriage and stuff.
Oh and you know what I want!
I do not have baby fever!
Have you lost your mind? Chandler, this isn't about me! This is about you and all your weird relationship commitment crap!

You don't know everything. Did you know that I'm going out with Rachel tonight instead of you? Hmm? And did you know that the only baby around here is you?! And did you know that I can't even look at you right now?! (She storms out.)
Gunther, can I get a coffee (Looks at Chandler) to go?
I'm still not done not wanting to talk to you.
What?!

Really? I'm really tired of being your relationship tutor. You're gonna have to figure this one for yourself. All right? Y'know what? If you're too afraid to be in a real relationship, then don't be in one. (She walks out.)
(raising her hand) I'm Monica.
Okay.
Wait what-wh-wh-what are you doing?!
No-no, don't-don't-don't do it!
Chandler, why are you doing this?
Chandler.
Do you umm, you really think the best reason to get married is because you're sorry?
(kneels with him) Chandler, umm, I want you to take just a minute and I want you to think about how ridiculous this sounds.
Honey! Do you know that none of that stuff came from me?! I mean I never said I wanted to have babies and get married right now!
Who? Two divorces and Joey?!
Y'know what? Y'know when I said that I want you to deal with this relationship stuff all on your own? Well, you're not ready for that.
Oh my God, what would have done if I said yes?
Well I think the length of teasing is directly related to how insane you were so, a long time.
Hey!
(checks to see if it works) Yes, you are so smart! (Kisses him.)
I know.
Wow!
Hey.
Oh yes, it is. I'm sorry I borrowed it, I was cold. I hope its okay?
I'm sorry, I'll give it back to you.
Are you saying I smell bad?
What's with him?
(cooking something) Phoebe, you were supposed to take that back!
Hey Joey, sweetie, taste this. (Holds out a spoon for him.)
What is going on with you?
What was the dream about?
Wait, Joey! Joey! That doesnt mean that-that you're in love with me!
No!
Or, it could mean that-that you saw Chandler and me together and we y'know were being close and stuff and then you just want to have that with someone too.
Um-hmm.
Well sure! I'm just wearing sweats! (Looking at Chandler and slowly realizing what his point is.) But that's good that you're not in love with me, because you just want a girlfriend!
You become friends after?
(laughing) That's right.
Joey, I thought you were gonna try to be friends first!
What about the closeness?
Who is it?
Let me try. (Gets up to join them.)
Did I squeeze it too hard?
Is he doing his shark attack bit yet?
Get in there man! Flirt back, mix it up!
(joining him) Wow! She is pretty, huh?
What happened?
No Joey, I think he's just watchin' TV.
What?
Wow! For just a week you guys are really close, huh?
I know it is the best.
What? It's still going on.
I-I am serious, I mean, we're, we're all over each other all the time.

(Start annoying hyper-competitive mode now.) (Jumping up) What don't you just calm down Phoebe! All right?! Why dont you just get all your facts before you run around telling everybody that you're the only hot couple!!
Oh no, it is okay, I mean as long as you know that Chandler and I are also very hot and fiery, just as hot as you! I mean our flame, whew, is on fire!
You are so cute. (She goes over and kisses him passionately.)
(entering from the bathroom) Hey Rach, a guy from Ralph Lauren called, you got a second interview!
Yes!
A kiss? What are you talking about?
He probably wants you back because you're right for the job.
Phoebe, do you want to go see a movie after dinner tonight?
What are you doing?
(That annoying competitiveness thing kicks in again, what the heck is that with her and why must the writers show it every flippin' episode?!) Oh, we're not seeing a movie!
Oh umm, that's because I just wanted to y'know walk in on me and Chandler while we were, y'know, doing it all night. Will you excuse me for just a second?
Okay. (She gets up and walks over to Chandler.) Chandler? Can I see you for a second?
Okay. (They walk away to get some privacy.) We have got to beat them! {Here we go yet again.}
'Cause, Gary and Phoebe think they're a hotter couple than we are!
So! So we've got to go upstairs and have a lot of sex to prove them wrong!
Phoebe and Gary are so gonna hear about this at dinner.
We are the hottest! Huh? No one is hotter than we are! You're the best.
No, you're the best.
I am the best.
(looking out the window) Hey Joey! Isn't that the girl that waved at you the other day?
Why?
What are you talking about? (Pointing out the window.) She obviously lives on the second floor, seventh apartment from the left!
No, those first two windows, (Points) that's the lobby. And y'know the other one over there, that's the stairway. You've been counting wrong.
You better believe he's tired, after the day we had! If you know what I mean. You know what I mean?
Phoebe, you have a, a twig in your hair.
You didn't!
The park huh? A public place.
I hear ya. Excuse me for just a second! (Gets up and heads for the bathroom as that annoying Gotta-win-at-all-costs-super-competitive thing kicks in again.)
Hi Chandler.
Yes it is. You see I've always found the men's bathroom very sexual. Haven't you?
Come on, we can't let them win!
Because Phoebe and Gary are in that-can't-keep-their-hands-off-each-other-doing-it-in-the-park phase!
I feel really sad that we're notreally there anymore.
Wasn't it a lot more exciting when we were y'know all over each other all the time?
Really?
That is so sweet. I know that I was acting a little crazy but umm, I feel the same way.
Yeah. (They hug.)
Did not.
Okay, I freaked out a little.
Thank God! I can't watch him anymore!
Besides, if anybody's gonna get free stuff, it's gonna be me.
I think it's a great idea. Yeah, we could have a dinner party and just invite her close friends.
I would love to do it together!
It's gonna be weird to watch some actor pretending to be Ben's dad.
That doesn't seem fair.
Rachel, you can go down there, you don't have to smoke. Just say you wanna get some fresh air.
Hey!
Yeah, me too! (Runs and grabs her 3-ring binder of ideas.)

All right, that's a little sketch of the cake, umm some sample menus, umm y'know what I thought we would start out with Tuscan style finger food, and for music, here's an alphabetized list of all my CDs! I've highlighted the ones that would go really good with the food.
Oh, we're not doing that. Okay
What?! I didn't take care of everything, there's-there's plenty of things for you to do!
(Thinks) Cups.
And ice!
Wait a minute, I can get ice at the restaurant
Hey! How'd the audition go?!
Wait a minute, are you doing Joey's (sadly) "Audition didn't go so well. (Happily) Yeah it did?"
You got a callback too didn't you?
(To Rachel) How did work go?
You stink!
No, I'm-I'm serious!
That's so gross!
Chandler! I have to tell you, you smell so smokey I have to get up. I'm not kidding. (She's not; she stands and walks away. Chandler moves closer.)
(overhearing that) Why don't you just go out with her!
Chandler! Everyone--no one's eating my Tuscan finger food 'cause they're all filling up on Phoebe's snow cones!
Y'knowgo! Go! Right there! (Points)
That's the surprise!
(entering from the bathroom) Hey! Happy Anniversary!
So umm, when I was in the shower I was thinking about our first night in London
Is that the one that speaks English or the one that doesn't?
That was some hot love you gave me! I'm gonna go get ready.
That's a great idea! I was saving them for something special.
(runs over to Phoebe) You have got to go home!
You gotta go home and get the earrings that you borrowed from me okay? Chandler wants me to wear them tonight.
Great!
(noticing Rachel crawling behind the couch) Rach? What are you doing?
It's a diaper commercial.
What's goin' on?
It's okay. I don't care. It's uh, it's fine.
It's no big deal, I do it all the time.
Sure! It doesn't mean anything! Just like I know it doesn't mean anything with you!
Chandler, this actually bothers you?
What?
(following her) Phoebe! I have to have those earrings, we're going to leave as soon as the show is over.
No you didn't.
Yeah, it's good.
Chandler! (Joey and his grandmother shush them and wave them away, which they do.) Okay, let me get this straight, it's okay for you to flirt, but not for me.
Go on, teach me something about men and women.
No way!
Well that's pathetic!
And this goes for all guys?
No! You are not gonna run out and leave her here!
(entering from her room) Phoebe! (Motions for the earrings. Phoebe gives her the one-minute sign.)
Yeah, what is it?
(shocked) Wow! All right well, I mean, what can you do? If you lost it you lost it.
All right, sweetie that's fine. You didn't do it on purpose.
Look at you! Come here! (They hug.) Feel better?

(angrily) That is exactly why I do not lend you stuff!! (Rachel looks over at Phoebe in resignation.) Okay?! I mean, first it's my jewelry! And if it's not my jewelry, it's-it's my blue sweater! And if it's not my sweater, it's my sunglasses!
Yes!
What about these? These look the same?
Not as each other!
Hi!
Yeah.
Ohh, you're about to get a little luckier.
Oh, honey, the earrings
My boyfriend really does have good taste!
Okay, guys, listen, don't forget that tomorrow is the day that Emily gets married again, so whatever we do, just try to really keep Ross's mind off of it.
Hey!
Hey! Oh, I'm so glad you're home, I thought tonight we could finally organize these photos!

Okay, I've broken them down into categories. Okay, we have uh, we got holidays, birthdays, candids, y'know And then what I've done is I've cross-referenced them by subject. Right? So if you're looking up, oh let's say birthdays and dogs, you get Photo 152. See? (Hands her the photo.)
You can also find him under umm, dog and dead.
All right, hand me that other box of photos; that's the very last one.
I hadn't! Photo 152 was a prototype.
All right, he's keys are in the drawer. Y'know what? I also need some cash.
Nah, while you're at Ross's if you see any lying around
What?! I-I-I don't, I don't do that!
(on the answering machine) Rach! It's me! Pick up!
I need a few more things to make the margaritas. Uhh, I need some salt, some margarita mix, and tequila.
See if he has ice.
(does Rachel's) Nooo!
Well thank God you were here! I mean, we have to erase that!

We have too! I mean what if Ross's hears that and then calls her back and then they get back together? Is that what you want? Ross back with that controlling, neurotic, crazy Emily? The Emily that wouldn't let him see you?
I'm his sister, okay? I love him! I don't want to see him get hurt! Come on! Doesnt that give me the right to control himhelp him?

No, look, she's obviously unstable, okay? I mean she's thinking about running out on her wedding day. (Rachel slowly turns and glares at her.) (Realizing what she just said.) Okay, fine! But I mean, look at the position she's putting him in! What's he gonna do? Ross is gonna run over there on the wedding day and break up the marriage?! I mean, who would do that?! (Rachel again turns and glares at her in disgust.) Okay, fine, all right, but that's y'know, it's different! Although it did involve a lot of the same people.
Y'know what, this is obviously some kind of twisted joke she's trying to play on him.
All right, I guess we should go.
Oh yeah right! (She grabs the money and shoves into her pocket.)
There's nothing we can do. You erased the message!
Well, if you're gonna be totally rational about this, I can't argue with you! All right? Fine, if you wanna tell him, tell him. I just don't want to be a part of it.
Wow! Play that message for Emily and this whole problem goes away!
Man, I would be great in a war! I mean, I really, I think I would make a fantastic military leader. I mean I know I would make General way before any of you guys.
No. I think we learned that from the sugarlips incident. I'm gonna get some tea.
So it looks like it's going really well for you two, huh?
(shocked) Oh my God!
I think that is so great! When are you gonna ask her?

I swear, I promise. I promise. Oh my God, I'm so excited! {And I just can't hide it! I'm about to lose control and I think I like it! Sorry, just couldn't resist it.} All right, listen let me tell you, do not get her flowers. Okay? Because y'know, she cries when they die, and there's the whole funeral
(sitting down) Gary's gonna ask you to move in with him!!
He just told me at the counter. He made me promise not to tell, but I couldn't hold it in any longer!
Relax! It's Phoebe! Not you!
Ohhhh!
That is so sweet! (She kisses him and turns to add some sugar to her tea.)
(entering) Hey guys!
Joey, I left my watch on the counter last night. (Goes to the counter) It was right here, where is it?
All right, come on, I'm-I'm late for work!
Guys, could you please just stop throwing the ball for one minute and just help me find it!
What?!
Really?!

(on phone, faking she's sick) I-I'm not gonna be able to make it into work today, I don't feel very good. (Joey makes a high throw and Monica has to catch it way over her head.) (Not sounding sick) Yes!! (Realizes what she just did.) (Sounding sick again) Wow! Uh, for a second there I thought I was really better, but I'm not. (Hangs up and keeps throwing the ball.)
Rach?
You have scratches all over you, what happened? (Rachel's arms are covered with scratches.)
(shocked) What?!
I don't want a cat!
(To Rachel) What?! You paid a thousand dollars for a cat when you owe me 300!!
(jumping in front of him) No-no! Don't do it! Don't!
He's a dropper!
Oh myOh good God!
So, why don't you just take it back to where you got it?
Rach, why won't they take it back?
Look, if you want you can keep it at our place until you find out what to do with it.
Oh my God, the cat's made my eyes water! Don't-don't throw it to me! My vision's been compromised!! (Quickly grabs a tissue to wipe her eyes.) Oh God! Okay. Okay. It's okay. Man, that was close.
So you're moving in with him. What happened?
Why, do you write him a lot?
Come on guys! Suck it up! We're closing in on ten hours! It's gut-check time!
Please! I made this game what it is.
All right, there's some pizza at my place, we can all eat with one hand right? Are you with me?
All right! Let's go! (Runs to the door.) Let's go Team Monica! (The guys all stop and stare at her) All right, we can work out the name later.
Rachel! What is your cat doing in one of my bowls!
Wow! You made a profit!
All right! Come on Monica! Look alive! Come on, look alive!
It's okay. It's okay. Just pretend that it didn't happen! Okay? No one needs to know! I mean, Phoebe's not an official ballplayer! I mean, only official ballplayers can drop the ball!
Okay! Okay, let's race! First one there wins! Ha-ha! (Runs out the door and everyone watches her leave.)
(To Rachel) Wow! It's really red! You should go see my eye doctor.
Since we've been going out, I think I've mentioned his name twice!
It's not Richard! Okay? It's this new guy and he's really good.
Hey Rach, remember that great song, Me, Myself, and I? (And on the "I" part she mimics poking her eye.)
Bye!
Why are so mad at him?
Well, it just seems that
Chandler! You don't have to ask for my permission. (Quietly) You can go.
Hey Rach, come on! We're gonna be late for the eye doctor appointment!

No. If you thought this mess is going to bother me, you are wrong! All right, let's go Blinky! (She ushers Rachel out the door, but before the door fully closes she sticks her head back in.) Chandler!!!! (Chandler agrees to clean up the mess.)
(looks at it more closely) Oh that's an eye removal machine.
I'm kidding! I'm kidding!
A small puff of air, now come on!
Y'know what, I'm gonna hold her head.
Okay. (Monica backs off.)
Dr. Miller? (She covers her right eye and reads from the chart) P E C F D.
I sure do! (She runs over to a drawer, opens it, and grabs a lollipop.) (To Rachel) And you don't get one!
They're still in my coat.
I love you.
I wanna say good-bye at the car!
Oh, I know! Umm, is it because he's always correcting people's grammar? Whom! Whom! Sometimes it's who!
Chandler! What are you doing here?
Not even close.
Okay! All right! Let's do it!
Sit down. (They sit down on the couch.)
Put your head back.
All right.
Now, open your eyes.
How many fingers am I holding up? (She's not holding any up.)
Oh my God, I was thinking four.
Yes! All right, y'know what? Why don't we start with a practice run? Okay?
No drops!
Okay.
On three, 123! (Rachel turns her head on three to avoid the drops.) Now my pillow's all wet! (She was trying to fool Rachel and squeezed the eyedropper.)
Then why did you move?!
All right, come here! (She gets up and drags Rachel off of the couch by her legs.)

I am going I'm going--Turn it over! (Rachel rolled onto her stomach and Monica rolls her back.) I'm I am going to get these drops in your eyes. (She is holding Rachel down with both hands and has the eyedropper in her mouth.)
(spitting out the eyedropper) Damn! It's empty!
(answers the phone) Hello? (Listens.) (To Phoebe) It's Joey. (Phoebe's proud of herself.) (To Joey) I'm so glad you called! Chandler told me what happened. Y'know he's really upset about it.
What did you do to his sweater vests?
Yeah, she's here. Hold on a second. (She hands the phone to Phoebe.)
Well, maybe you should send him something. So that when he gets to Las Vegas he'll know that you're sorry.
(answering it) Hello?
Hey Joey! Aww, you remembered even though you're a big star!
Joey, what's it like on a movie set, huh? Do you have a dressing room? Do you have a chair with your name on it?
Go!!
Okay! Okay! Okay! (She succeeds in getting the eye drops in and everyone climbs off of Rachel.) We'll see you in about 3 to 4 hours.
(entering) Phoebe? (Phoebe comes back into the living room) Oh, Phoebe, I'm so sorry. Have you been here long?
Okay, you can not tell Chandler. Okay? That I ran into Richard.
The Richard.
Noo! My ex-boyfriend Richard! Y'know the tall guy, moustache?
It was, it was really nice. We started talking and I-I ended up having lunch with him.
Really?
The strange part was, he was really nice, umm and he looks great, but I didn't feel anything at all!
Because it would totally freak him out and tomorrow's our anniversary. I just don't want anything to spoil that.
I know.
What?
It's almost our anniversary!
I got you a present!
I know, but you have to open it today! (Hands it too him.)
(grabbing the gift from him and opening it) Okay! There you go! It's two tickets to Vegas!
For this weekend! Oh gosh, it would be perfect, we get to see Joey plus we get to start our anniversary celebration on the plane. We can call it out plane-aversary.
No.
Oh, he just doesn't want us to go through any trouble. Think of how excited he'll be when we go out and surprise him! Plus we get to have our own, ani-Vegas-ary! A-Nevadaversary!
But we can go, right?
Okay!
Ditch you? Phoebe, you were pregnant with the triplets!
Aww! I love you!
Okay!
I love the "I forgot the present" fake out!
Oh that's okay. Dont worry about it, you can give it to me when we get back.

Okay, I umm, I ran into Richard yesterday and he asked me if I wanted to go for a bite and I did. The only reason I didn't tell you is because I knew you'd get mad and I didn't want to spoil our anniversary.
Really?!
Great!
Phoebe, you don't eat animals.
Who are you talking too?
I'm so sorry.
I knew you were not okay with that.
It meant nothing! Okay? After all this time, how can you not trust me?
You're right. I'm sorry. I should've told you.
I promise you, next time I will absolutely tell you.
I can not see him? I mean, you can't tell me what to do!
Oh y'know what? If you're gonna be acting like this all night, I really, I don't even want to be around you.
Fine! Happy Anniversary!
No it is not!
(to the bartender) Thank you.
I can't believe this! This is like the worst night ever!
This is crazy! I mean, it's such a stupid argument. I don't even wanna see Richard again.
Y'know what? You're right Phoebe. You're right. Thank you! (Gets up to find Chandler.)
Anybody lose this? (Holds up the chip and the woman next to her shakes her head no.)
Hmm.
All right baby, come on! (Rolls the dice) Yes! Yes! I am on fire!
Wait Chandler, what are you doing?!

What? Wait! Why? (He turns and heads for the door and she chases after him.) Chandler! Chandler! Wait! Im sorry, I was just playing for one second! I was trying to find you to tell you that, look if you don't want me to see Richard again, I won't! He means nothing to me!
Not any more.
Really! (They hug and kiss) All right? Let's forget about this going home stuff and celebrate our anniversary. (She picks up his suitcase.) Okay, this is empty.
Yeah, I couldn't be mad at him for too long.
We have one.
(shaking the dice) A new pair of shoes for the Chan-Chan man! (Rolls the dice.) Yes!
That's right baby! Okay, what do I want now?
Pick a number! That is your only job!
Thank you!
Yes!
(To Chandler) We're not really gonna buy these people steak dinners are we?
Okay, good! Okay, what do I want now?
What?
Okay. (Rolls the dice)
All right, biggest suite in the place. Come on! (Rolls the dice.)
Oh, that's because I had lunch with RichMe neither! Okay, what do I want now?
Hard 8?! We should call it easy 8!
Shut up!! It just got interesting!
What did you just say?
Are you serious?!
I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.
Okay!
Nobody move! (To Chandler) Okay, you look that way; I'll look this way!
That could be a four or a five. It's your call.
I think so too.
Okay, come on, I can't get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.
You're so efficient. I love you!
No-no-no! We need something old!
That'll work!
Okay, now we just need something borrowed!
That's stealing!
Ohh. (Rubs her fake stomach.)
Yep, we wanna get married!
What are you doing?
No, only because that's the graduation song.
Are you sure you wanna do this?
Whoa!
What are you guys doing here?
Why else would we be here?
This is insane!
What are you talking about? If you get married in Vegas youre married everywhere.
Yeah!
Hey.
How do I tell Chandler that its too soon. Its gonna break his heart, hes not gonna think that I dont love him anymore.
Yes I do!
Oh hi! Hi! Yknow, we were just talking about bacon.
Rach! We werent gonna miss our friends getting married!
What are you guys gonna do?
So, what do you think we should do?
I know I love you! (They hug.)
Thats a good question. Look umm, last night we let the dice decide. Maybe we should leave it up to fate again. I love you!
All right, eight we get married, but 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12 we dont get married.
Okay. (They approach the craps table.)
Ready?
(sarcastic) Come on eight.
Wow! I cant believe I actually rolled an eight.
Wait a minute. That wasnt a hard eight! Last night I rolled a hard eight.
I wanted it so bad! (Pause) Wanna go pack?

Ohh, of course we are! (They walk up to the elevators.) We left it up to fate. (Pushes the elevator button.) If we were supposed to get married there would be a clear-cut sign. (The elevator door opens to a priest reading from a bible with Chandler and Monica standing side-by-side holding each others hands.)
That kid really kicked me hard on the plane.
He took my snack!
Okay! Oh God, yknow what? Its really bad.
This doesnt mean anything, does it?
Okay.
No, dont say it! Dont even think it!
Im sick of the signs! Its too fast, Im happy the way things are!
I dont want things to change! Do you?
All right then, then nothing changes! Everything is great! Everything stays the same! And you go unpack because its been three days and its driving me insane!
Then all your stuff would be here.
Then youd be going back and forth all the time, I mean it doesnt make any sense.
Live together? There have been no signs for that.
Yes! Okay! Okay! Wait-wait-wait!
Heres your key (Gets him one.)
Heres your key. All right, you have to christen it! Now, go out and come back in!
Ready!
Wait! Oh my God! I cant get out!
No, its not a sign! Its a very old key!
Oh my God its old!
I love you!
No.
Of course! Joey wouldnt let you have one?
Hey, have you figured out a way to tell him youre moving out?
Yknow, I really have to tell Rachel, but I We just have to get it over with! Yknow, the next time we see them were just gonna tell them. Okay? Thats it.
Pretty much.
Hi!
Joey, we have something to tell you.
Wait! Joey! Joey! Are you okay?!
Hey Pheebs!
Hey, have you seen Rachel?
I have some pretty exciting news!
No! Chandler and I are moving in together!
Hey!
Well umm, Chandler and I are moving in together.
Okay, come here! (Phoebe joins them in the hug.)
Okay, I gotta go find Rachel but umm, if you guys see her could you please try to give her some really bad news so that mine doesnt seem so bad? (Exits.)
Ugh, I thought you were Rachel!
I just tell her, I have to get it over with. I told Ross and Phoebe and shes the only one left!
No.
Have a seat. (They sit at the table.) Okay, listen umm, Chandler and I are going to live together, here.
Really?!
Yes, we are. (Chandler is frantically trying to get Monica to correct her.)
Yeah, hes gonna work on that.
(singing) Well be waiting for you
Soon! I-I just couldnt before. You saw how upset Joey got! I couldnt do that to her, shes my best friend!
Im not your best friend?
All right, all right, at least Im prepared.
(slapping his hand) Hey!
These arent for you! Are you upset?
Rach, theres something uh, important I have to tell you.

And-and-and if I die, from a long illness. And youre writing out my eulogy and you open a desk drawer and you find a note from me that says, "I will always be with you," and you still cant shed one tiny tear, I know youll be crying a river inside.

Bye.

Oh my God! Thats great! Oh wow! (Hugs him.) Youre a published writer! I wish I had a present for you!
Wait a minute! (Quickly checks her pockets and pulls out) My last Kit-Kat bar!
Okay!!
Its not mayonnaise!!
Hey Joey, Chandler sold a story to Archie Comics!
Yeah, a lot. A lot, a lot!
Well, yknow its none of my business, but arent you married?
Well, youre not.
Yeah I can! (Laughs) And dont think I dont, because I do! I mean all the time, you betcha! (Laughs.)
(giggles) Of course I have! What do you think, Im some 30 year old virgin?
Say it louder, I dont think the guy all the way in the back heard you!

Its not like, I havent any opportunities. I mean, yknow, Im just waiting for the perfect guy. Im seeing this guy Roger, all right? Hes not perfect, but umm, I think maybe I should just get it over with. Yknow, give him my flower.
Yknow what? You are right?!
Rachel! Im never gonna think its okay for you to cheat on your husband!
Phoebe, why is smoke coming out of the bathroom?!
Phoebe! Put that cigarette out!
Put it out!!
(handing her a cup) Here you go sweetie.
But, I put some honey in it.
Well, you used to like playing the guitar.
I hope youre hungry, were starting with oysters. And yknow what they say about oysters, dont you?

People! People say it! Come here! (She grabs him and kisses him.)
And then were gonna have a little Middle Eastern cous-cous. Something we can eat, with our hands.

I cant promise anything. (She starts to dig in.)

Well, tonight waswas going to be my first time.

Chandler, Im gonna die a virgin!

No! (They both laugh.) Oyster?

Noo!! Okay!!
Umm, do you have any uhh, moves?
I have no moves. (He moves in to kiss her and she laughs and backs away.) Okay, whatcha doin there?! (Giggles.) Oh yknow what? Im sorry, this is just too weird.
What if I turn out the lights? (Runs to shut them off.)
Chandler?
Thats the couch.

Hey!
Hey, check me out, Im a slut!

Are you okay?
Great! Its so amazing! I mean, last time Dr. Roger came over, I was so nervous, but then after being with you Im all like, "Can the doctor see me now?"
Yknow, I dont have an appointment, but I sure could use a physical. (He laughs halfheartedly) Are you sure youre okay?
Yeah, come on, eat, whatever you want. Dr. Roger got beeped again.
What?!
Why would you do that?
Really?
Chandler!
There was just one woman, wasnt there?
Including me?
(entering) Hey!
Oh, yeah.
Yes! Why, did youyou forget to make yours?
Okay. (They kiss.) Okay, I cant wait! This is going to be the best Valentines Day ever! (Chandler giggles and exits.) I cant believe it! Make the presents! Make the presents!
Im just so excited to make the presents! (Chandler does another sarcastic/scared laugh and leaves.) Shoot!

Okay.

Okay.

(Points to the bedroom.)

I wanna wake up early and go get it for you!
Oop, your cake is ready!

The Way You Look Tonight is on here! Dance with me?
You are just the sweetest. (They kiss.)

(pointing to the kitchen) Yeah you will! (Points to the bedroom) And, are you kiddin me?!

Does that smell bother you?
Well you let me know if you can, because yknow I can bake a pie to cover it.
Okay!

Joey that is so sweet.

But you should eat them now because theyre hot from the oven.

Chandler, do you think we talk about our relationship enough?
Hey!
(laughs sarcastically) Rachel is not going to pick your stupid guy.
Yeah!
Well, uh yknow, our guy works with Chandler and hes really nice and smart and hes a great dresser!
Youre not supposed to look!

Our guys a great dancer!
(To Chandler) Do you want our guy to be your guy?

Well, spring vacation is doing nice things with your grandparents. Spring break youre doing frat guys.
And slept with the professor.
Yes! We found you a really cute and funny guy from Chandlers work!
Uh, would you stop it with that already?!
Are you funny? Tell us a joke!
All right guys stop it. Rachel, were very sorry that is a very insensitive thing for us to do. And yknow what? Let us make it up to you, we have two really great guys for you.
In 1981 you were 13!
Hey!
Hey!
Were really glad you decided to meet our guy.
Youre gonna like him so much. So umm, when do you want to meet him?
Eldad, this is Rachel.
Okay! Okay! We can take a hint! (They start to leave but run into Phoebe with her guy in tow.) (To Phoebe) What are you doing here?!
No! You cant do that!
(stopping him) Sit down! Were winning!
Rachel! Rachel! You havent touched Eldads hair!

I'm outa here. [Monica leaves]

Was it...
(startled) Ahh! Arent you dressed yet?
Were supposed to meet my parents in 15 minutes.
Wh?! What about my allergies?!

Oh, stop beating yourself up! People make mistakes! These things happen! There arent any message youve forgotten to give me are there? (Chandler has a disgusted look on his face.) Apparently youre not very good at it! I
Yknow what? He will forgive you. And I like to bring a pad with me when I go answer the phone just in case (Chandler gets that disgusted look back.) Okay
You had no right to go out with him.
You sold me out.
Yes you did. You absolutely sold me...
Did you just flick me?
Fine!

I think our lovers spat will start a little early this month.
We know how tough those parent/teacher conferences can be.
Ross!!
How crazy that wed run into you!
(obviously attracted to him) Is-is-is there a-a Mrs. Stevens?
Yknow, it is so strange seeing Ross here this time of day, cause usually hes got the childrens hospital.
And hes a great brother!
Ohh!

You said the baby.

How was your first day?

(writing on a piece of paper) Phyllis is sitting in a chair.
(still writing) Phyllis sees what Im doing.

We said six!

Ugh!
What time?
Inside of telling us you decided to write in your stupid book!
Hi!

I mean think about all the money that youre gonna make!

Soakin up all the culture.
Where do you want to start?

Phoebe, that stuff is

Well Rachels not here! (Runs out.)
(going over to him) Im so sorry. Please, stop freaking out.

Chandler, please dont think I was trying to pressure you. Phoebe and Rachel

Really?
I know! I know.
Im gonna go tell Joey that (laughs) that youre back. I was really worried about you. (Exits.)
Still crying?
Yknow, I only know of two surefire ways to shut a man up. And one of them is sex.
I dont know, Ive never had to use the other one. Im just saying yknow, if were having sex, hes not gonna be talking.
Oh, we have some
(entering) Hey!
Whats the big deal?
Ross let me ask you a question. All jokes aside, where is this relationship going?
Do you really see this as a long-term thing?
Hi guys.

What are you doing?
Are you okay?
Yeah. Im okay. Im actuallyIm a little cold, can I have your jacket?
(laughs) Are you sure youre okay?
Ohh thats sweet!
(interrupting him) Oh my God!
Oh my God, Richard. (Yep, Richards back.)
Oh God, maybe he wont see us. Richard!
Hey, its good to see you!
YeahOh thats right. You, you always wanted me too. Hey, I see you got your mustache back.
Chandler, wh-why dont we sit down?
(to Richard) Its good to see you
And so, were hiding in the bathroom.
So I hide in the shower and the next thing you know theyre going at it right on the bathroom floor.
Ohh.

If the school finds out youre fired.
Shes leaving for three months.

Look Ross, the only question you need to ask is, "Do you see a future?" I mean like do you see yourself marrying her? (Ross pauses in consideration.) Oh my God! You did it already! You married her, didnt you?!
Okay well I thinkthats your answer.
Why do you want to see my hand?
(suspiciously) Okay. (Exits to carry out Phoebes wishes.)
(entering) I had to go all the way to the basement because some idiot keeps stuffing the trash chute with pizza boxes!
(entering) Hi guys!
What are you up too?

What uhWhat did youWhat?!

Oh God (Starts looking around.) Why dont they put chairs back here?!

What were you doing in Africa?
Ohhh! What are you doing to me?! Oh look, I-I Im sorry but umm, this-this-this-this is not going to happen.
Well he is! Yeah, I mean marriage is all he talks about! My goodness, in fact, Im the one thats making him wait!
Yeah!
Why? Because of the government.
So that marriage stuff that you were saying yesterday, you dont really believe that do you?
Yeah, but thats pigs not people!
Wait a minute. Are you honestly telling me that-that you may never want to get married?
Oh my God! Then-then-then what are we even doing?! What is this?!
Yknow what?! I gotta go! Ugh!
Have you seen Rachel? Or a mirror?
Yeah, its great.
Im just having one of those days where you realize youre in a dead-end relationship!
Its not like I want to get married tomorrow! Its just that I-Id like to believe that Im in a relationship thats actually going somewhere, that Im not just wasting my time!
No I dont know Chandler! Not anymore! Its like its like somethings changed.
I didnt change!
What?!
Is that some kind of boat talk?
What does he think? Does he think Im just gonna wait around for nothing?
(starts for the door) Well theres some people who do want to marry me.
Yeah! Richard!
Thats right.
You just told me that he hates marriage! That-that hes a-a complex fellow whos unlikely to take a wife! That-that hes against marriage and always will be!
Hi.
I dont know why Im here.
I dont know.
(entering) Chandler is such an idiot!
Yeah, Ill have a scotch
(moving over to the couch) Still smoking cigars?

Edward Nevski?

(to the mask) I missed you-you ugly, flat faced old freak!

Nothing. (She backs away a little bit but is still in his arms and looks up at his eyes.) I dont knUmm. I dont know. Umm

Yes.

Oh

Thunder being stolen!!

(yelling after them) I cant believe youre gonna have sex on my engagement night!!
