Well, y'know those special skills I have listed on my resume? I would love it would be great if one of those was true.
Really? Who-who have you taught?
Yeah that'd be great! Thanks Pheebs!
Nice!! Yeah! Is that part of your resolution, your new thing for today?
You all right Chandler? Is there something funny about that name?
Oh really! Where? Somewhere funny I'd bet! (Chandler is straining to keep quiet as Phoebe enters.)
See ya! All right Pheebs, I am ready for my first lesson.
Umm, okay.
Hey, Pheebs! Check-check this out. (Holds up his hand in one of Phoebe's chords.)
Yeah listen so, I thought I was getting better, so on my way home today I stopped by this guitar store and
No.
Yes!
Yeah! (Chandler bangs the table in frustration.)
You look like a freak.

Well, everyone will enjoy my music as well. (Does a chord and Monica starts taking pictures of him and Phoebe. They both start to strike a pose with the excessive amount of pictures that Monica takes.)
Yes! Yes, I did.
(thinks) (quietly) G-sharp.
What?! I didn't touch a guitar!
No, I'm not questioning it, I'm saying it's stupid! (Notices Monica standing between them and smiling.) What?! (The camera clicks, taking another picture.)
Your other student, was you!

(looking in the Yellow Pages) Look, maybe I need to try a real teacher! Right here! Here! Andy Cooper, he teaches guitar and look ooh, there's a nice picture of him with a little kid and THE KID'S GOT A GUITAR!!!!!! (Storms out.)
(answering phone) Hello?
Uhh, Chandler's not here.
Okay.
Nice!
Oh. That is quite a situation. Uh, do you see any like, powder?
Good-good, okay, sprinkle some of that on your legs, it'll absorb some of the moisture and then you can get your pants back up.
Umm, do you see anyoh, Vaseline?
Yeah, sure, spread some of that on there.
Ross? You okay?
Really?! Uhh, what color is it?
Well, I'm justif the paste matches the pants, you can make yourself a pair of paste pants and she won't know the difference!
(To Ross) Uh, Rachel's here, so good luck man, let me know how it works out. (He hangs up the phone and strands Ross in the bathroom.)
Oh well, you're timing couldn't be better. I am putting out fires all over the place.
What-what is it, what is it?
Oh no, no-no-no-no! I don't want to know!
I don't care, Rach! Look, I am tired of being the guy who knows all the secrets but can't tell anyone!
And you're not supposed to be gossiping!!
I'm not listening to you!
Hey, Pheebs?

Look, Pheebs, I just, I wanna apologize for, for saying that your method was stupid and-and maybe ask you to be my teacher again. And-and I promise, I won't touch a guitar until you say I'm ready. (After a short pause she hands him her guitar.) You really think I'm ready?

Wow! Cool! (He takes the guitar, stands up, and goes to play a note. However, while strumming it, he knocks it out of his hands and it bounces off the table and lands on the floor. Phoebe just stares at the guitar.)
(sitting back down) Was the chord at least right
Howdy partner!
Umm?
Oh, no! (Starts that screaming thing again. Rachel stops him by pulling his fingers out of his ears.)
Well, then it wouldn't be a secret. So yeah, that would be okay. Yeah. Yeah!
Now? You want me to go over there now?
Do you know something?
I might know something.
What's the thing you know?
I can't tell you what I know.
Okay, fine.
You don't know!
(gasps) YOU KNOW!!!!
Yeah, I know!!!!

Too long! Oh my God, Rach, I've been dying to talk to someone about this for so long! Listen, listen, we can't say anything about this to anybody, they're so weird about that! Listen (Phoebe returns and interrupts them.)
Oh, I am going to go for a walk in the rain.
Rach, I told you everything I knew last night! Look, it's not that big of a deal, so Monica and Chandler are doing it.
Sorry. Monica and Chandler are making love.
(thinks) I don't know.
I don't know.
(thinks) I don't know.
Ohh, I know one thing!
They did it right there on the couch.
Hey Ross!
(eyeing the flattened scone) Anybody gonna eat that?
(entering from his room) All right! Everybody ready to go to the movies?
Really?
Oh. Are you sure you don't want to come? Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, they get mail and stuff.
All right, let's go Pheebs.
Maybe we should check the trash chute.
That's right, he almost could. Which is exactly how I got stuck there.
(snaps his fingers) He hooked up! He hooked up with someone.
He hooked up!! Tell us about her!
All right, hold on! Hold on. Hold on. This is Ross, okay? He's our friend. He obviously went crazy. He obviously lost his mind.
Phoebe! Don't put ideas in his head!
Damnit Phoebe!!
All right, put your 20 bucks down. First one to find the tasty treat wins. Okay?

All right. Let's get the contestants out of their isolation booths. (He removes the waste bucket that's over the duck and the laundry basket that's over the chicken.) And they're off! (He puts his foot in front of the chick, stopping it from moving.)
Judge rules, no violation.
Yeah!
What?!
And the duck gets the Nutter-Butter!
Judge rules, Nutter-Butter.
Yeah.
(entering) Hey Rach! Hey, you mind if I read my comic books in here?
Oh well, Chandler and Monica are over there and it's kinda hard to concentrate.
Umm, hi.
Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her.
Whoa, dude, look out! You almost crushed my hat! (He picks a hat up from the floor. It's one of those magician stovepipe hats.)

Oh! Yeah, look there's this play all right? And I'm up for the part of this real cool like suave international guy. A real clothes horse. So I figure that everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y'know, ultra-hip, high fashion stuff.
Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this.
Great! Thanks, Rach!
All right.
Are you all right?
Pheebs! Sorry!
Pheebs, I'm so sorry.
All right, then you'd better show me some of that too then.
Really? A purse?
It looks like a women's purse.
See look, women, carrying the bag. (He puts it on his shoulder and looks at himself in the mirror and likes what he sees.) But it is odd how a women's purse looks good on me, a man.
Maybe you need sex. I had sex a couple days ago.
Well, I ain't gonna say no to that.
Hey!

What? Are you referring to my man's bag? At first, I thought it just looked good, but it's practical too. Check it out! It's got compartments for all your stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!
Yeah, but sandwich time is right now. (Removes a sandwich and starts eating.)
Why would I return it? I love this bag!
Fine! Do you take Vasa or Mustercard? (He's holding the fake credit cards that come with the bag.)
All right relax, look I'll pay you with the money from the acting job I am definitely gonna get thanks to you.
U-N-I-sexy? (Smiles provocatively.)
Hey Pheebs, I'm so sorry.
Here, I brought you some flowers. (He pulls them out of the bag.)

(approaches, wearing his glasses) Hey you guys, check it out. Check it out. (Moves his hand towards and away from his face.) It's like it's coming right at me. (Chandler helps out a little bit by pushing on Joey's arm, which causes his hand to slap him in his face.)
What did you say to him?
(entering, with bag) Hey! I'm off to my audition. How do I look?

Y'know what? Make fun all you want. This is a great bag! Okay? And it's as handy as it is becoming. Now, just because you don't understand something, doesn't make it wrong. All right? So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact that Joey, (pats the bag) comes with a bag! (Exits.)
(reading from the script) Well, you must be new here. Why don't we get a table and I'll buy you a drink.
Yeah, sure. (He takes it off and starts reading.) Well, you must be new here. Maybe we shouldI'm sorry, can I ask you something? (He stops and asks a question.)
Well, first it's not a purse.
I mean if-if you're thinking it's a woman's bag, it's not. It's a man's bag!
All right look, let me show you the catalog! (Does so.) See? Huh? It's the latest thing! Everyone's got one! Men! Women! Children! Everyone's carrying them!
Noooo. No-no-no, these babies sell themselves.
Yeah but I didnt read anything.
Okay! All right, I'll see ya. (As he's walking off stage.) (Patting the bag.) We got it! We got it!
(dejected) Hi.
Estelle said I didn't get it. (Sits down next to Rachel on the couch.)
Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems with me.
Well to tell you the truth, they uh, (Pause) they had a problem with the bag!
Y'know what? It was a stupid play anyway!
I don't wanna give up the bag. I don't have to give up the bag! Do I Rach? (She's avoiding his eyes.) Oh, you think I should give up the bag!
I can't believe I'm hearing this!
Hey, yeah! Then we could do that telephone thing! Y'know, you have a can, we have a can and it's connected by a string!
(entering) Hey guys!
What? What?
You mean how they're friends and nothing more? (Glares at Rachel.)
Yes, but y'know what? It doesn't matter who knows what. Now, enough of us know that we can just tell them that we know! Then all the lying and the secrets would finally be over!
No-no-no! No-no wait Rach, you know what would even be more fun? Telling them.
I can't take any
Noo! I can't take any more secrets! (To Rachel) I've got your secrets. I've got their secrets. I got secrets of my own y'know!
Oh yeah? Well, you don't know about Hugsy, my bedtime penguin pal. (Joey shies away.)
Ugh.
Yeah?
Well I didn't tell them!
Uhhh, Phoebe and Joey.
And Rachel. I would've told you but they made me promise not to tell!
I'm sorry! But hey, it's over now, right? Because you can tell them that you know they know and I can go back to knowing absolutely nothing!
No! Not unless! Look this must end now!
I'm listening.
So he likes to break stuff.
Yeah, poor cat, never saw that big butt coming.
No.
They know you know.
I couldn't even if I wanted too.
(looking out the window) Hey-hey, check it out! Check it out! Ugly Naked Guy has a naked friend!
(entering the hall) Oh man! Aren't you guys done yet?! I wanna sit in my chair!
Ooh!
I like that! (To Phoebe) Oh, okay! Show him your bra! He's afraid of bras! Can't work 'em! (He swiftly rips open the front of Phoebe's dress revealing her bra.)
It's not my first time.
Dude!
All right! So that's it! It's over! Everybody knows!
(panicking) Dude! He's right there!

Okay, all right, whew! What do you say we all clear out of here and let these two lovebirds get back down to business? (Ross turns and glares at him.) Hey-hey-hey, I-I-I'm just talking here, he-he's the one doing your sister.
(quickly) I call Godfather!
Sure, if you cared enough to call it first.
(to her) Oh, hey Katie! Everyone, this is Katie.
So, are you ready to go?
Oh sure, right back there. (Points.)
I was thinking Chinese food.
I don't know. I mean I like her a lot, and she's really nice, but
(shyly) She keeps punching me.
Hey, it's a lot harder than it looks! Okay? (Quietly) She-she-she's hurting me.
(sets the coffee down) Y'know, breadstick fangs are always funny.

Uhh, look Katie, uh listen, we-we need to talk. Okay? Umm, look I like you. I-I really do, I like you a lot. Okay? But sometimes when you, when you playfully punch me like that it-it feels like someone's hitting me with a very tiny but very real bat.
No-no.
Yeah, big!
Uh-oh, shht! The Misses.
Hey!
Thanks! I've been working out. Hey listen, is it obvious that I'm wearing six sweaters?

Well look, Im breaking up with Katie so I had to put on some extra padding. Y'know? I mean, if she hits me when she's happy, can you imagine how hard she's gonna hit me when I tell her I'm taking away the Joey love?
Hey! Hiya!
Huh.
Uhh.
Nah.
What a bad idea!
She's right y'know.
Hey Ross, will you pass me that knife?
Oh, it's okay. You don't have to be so mean about it.
That's not funny at all!
Hey!
What are you guys doing up?
(thinks) Dark red.
Aww, you guys are so cute!
All right, I'll see you in the morning.
(entering) Hey, you guys!
(To Monica) Hey. That uh, that my sweatshirt?
Well uh, it's just that uh, y'know if-if you're gonna be wearing someone's sweatshirt shouldn't it be your boyfriends--and Im not him.
No-no! No! I mean it's gonna be all smelling like Monica!
No! No, you smell like a meadow. (Pause.) I'm sorry. (Runs to the bathroom.)
(To Phoebe) Hey! (Sees that Monica's there.) Oh.
Yeah, I didnt know you guys were going to be here.
(backing away) What?! Why?!
Nothing!
All right! There is something. I kinda had a dream, (pause) but I don't want to talk about it. (Starts for his room.)
Well, it involved Monica.
Don't worry, there wasn't any sex in it or anything. I haven't dreamt about her like that since I found out about you two--ish.
Well, okay. You were my girlfriend and we were doing the crossword puzzle. Y'know like you guys were doing last night. So, that's it. I'm in love with Monica and I'll be moving out.
It-it doesnt?
That kinda sounds like your dream dude.
In the dream I did enjoy the closeness.
(looks at her) Not really.

No, I don't think it's just about just getting a girlfriend. Y'know? I mean, yeah, I can get a girlfriend! Yeah, we could sit in the chair and do crosswords, but y'know are we ever going to have y'know the closeness like-like you guys have?
Friends first? That's interesting.
No, never done that either.
(in a sexy voice) How you doin'?
Oh, I'd love too, but I got acting class. But y'know what? I guess I can blow that off, (In a sexy voice) for you.
Uh, hey, Rach let me ask you something. Uh, I was just over there talking to Monica and Chandler, boy they are really tight.
Yeah that's not such a bad situation they got going over there. I'm thinking of getting me one of those.
Well, the reason I think Monica and Chandler are so great
is because they were friends first. Y'know? So I asked myself, "Who are my friends?" You and Phoebe, and I saw you first. So
I'm saying maybe you and I crank it up a notch.
I'll treat you real nice. (Pulls out a chair for her.)
Won't-won't that take longer?
Yeah. I understand. I understand. (Pause) Man, I wish I saw Phoebe first!
(entering) Hey!
Yeah, yeah, I met this woman. (Starts for his room.)
Uhh, well, she'sreally good in bed.
(To Rachel) Well look, hey, it's all your fault!

Well because you didn't give me advice! No! You gave me a pickup line! As soon as I told her I wanted to y'know, build a foundation and be friends first. I suddenly, through no fault of my own, became irresistible to her! (Pause) And her roommate!
Closeness-shmoshness! There was three of us for crying out loud!
(entering) All right! Hey, who wants pizza?!
(taking a bite) Oh, great! Can you believe I found it on the second floor?
Uhh, just a minute officer!!
Boy, that guy's underwear sucks!
I got this pair marked excess, I gotta tell ya, there was no room for excess anything in there.
That's right Ross, I can see you in your new apartment! And you can see me! Same as yesterday, (To Monica) same as the day before.
Nope. Op, wait! There he goes.

(waving) Very funny Ross! Very life-like and funny. Okay. (Notices that a woman is waving back.) Oh no-no-no, I wasn't waving at you lady. (She just stares at him.) (Joey sees how beautiful she is.) Whoa, maybe I was! Hey, Monica, this totally hot girl in Ross's building is flirting with me.

Yeah, I-I-I'm down with that. (He turns back to the woman.) Okay, here goes. (Thinks.) How (Holds up his hand like an Indian) you (Points at her) a-doin'? (Does a little twisting motion with both hands and ends up pointing at her, he then winks. She smiles and waves again.) (To Monica) It worked! She's waving me over. (Towards the woman.) Okay, I-I-I'll be right over. Let's see, she's on the third floor
Tell me about it, huh? (Realizes that she can see Monica.) Oh no-no-no, I'm not with her, she's just Monica! (He pantomimes that out.) Ewwuck! (He pushes Monica away and makes a disgusted face.)
This is your place?
But I counted, you're not supposed to live here! Oh man! (Runs away.)
Ugh!!

I ended up at Ross's place. Oh, I musta missed counted or something. (Looks out the window.) Damn! She's not there anymore. Oh, l-l-look, Ross is doing his 'Watching TV' bit. (We see Ross sitting on the couch and flipping through the channels on his remote.)
Did you tell the guy you wanted to have sex with his wife and then fall right out of your chair?
What happened?
You kissed him?!
I bet that kiss isn't looking like such a big mistake now, is it?
Yeah! (Chandler makes a noise) No?
Oh Rachel look, don't say that, I think you just need a hug from Joey. Come on. Come on. (She hugs him and Joey looks out the window.) She's back! Hot girl's back!

No, in Ross's building! (He throws Rachel onto the chair and heads to the window.) She's back! She's back! (Pantomimes) Okay, wait there, I'll be over in a second. (He counts where she is again.) Got it! (Runs out and does a little hot over a chair.)
Damnit!! Did you move?!
(Looking around) Uhh do you happen to have a hot girl in there?
Yeah. Sorry about that. (He walks away and knocks on the next door which is answered by a little girl.) Oh, hey little girl. Uhh, is-is your mommy, or sister, or babysitter by any chance a hot girl?
Later! (He runs away down the hall and hides behind a corner to a whole other corridor.) Oh man! (Walks down the hallway in desperation.) Hot girl! Hot girl!!
(entering) Hey guys! (Sees their state of undress) What 'cha been doin'? (Has a silly grin.)
I don't know. But I can see through your sheet. (He looks out the window.) Yeah, yeah, that's her. But y'know what? Doesn't matter, I'm never gonna get to meet her anyway.
Because it's impossible to find her apartment! She lives in some like of hot girl parallel universe, or something.
No. No. No. She lives on the third floor, eighth apartment from the left.
I did not know that! Thank you Monica. (Starts to leave) I can't believe I almost lost another girl because of counting.
Dahhhhh!! (Ross has a puzzled look on his face.) No! Noooo!! (Storms off.)
Okay, pick a card.
All right now, memorize it. (Pause) You got it?
(holding up the Queen of Clubs) Is that your card? (He winks and smiles.)

(reading the card) Whoa! This guy is like the biggest commercial casting director in town! (Ross gasps) Ben takes one lousy walk in the park and gets an audition!! (Ross and Carol stare at him, then Joey realizes what he just said.) I mean, way to go Ben! (Gives Ben the thumbs up, which Ben returns.) Man! I've been in that park a million times and no one offered me an audition.
I'm always on the swings! What am I doing wrong?!
Luck!
Whoa-whoa, but her birthday isn't like for another month.
Ross!! We're having a surprise party for Rachel!!
Done.
They're gonna do it together.
What, so I gotta shut it down now?
Whoa-whoa dad? There's a dad in the commercial?
Whoa, hey, maybe I'll go down there with ya and see if I can get an audition to play the dad. I mean who better to play Ben's father than his godfather.
What?! Are you kidding?!
All right!
Hey! I'm in, they're gonna let me audition!
I know! I know! It turns out that one of the casting ladies has actually seen me in a play, so I steered clear of her

Oh yeah, yeah! He's done tons of commercials. I've seen him in like Sugar Smacks, Playstation, and that one for the phone company. In fact he was so good in that one, he actually convinced me to switch phone companies. Chandler was mad.
That's great. Listen, wouldn't it be great though if I got to play Ben's dad?
I look more like him than you do! (He winks at Carol.)
(also downtrodden) Yeah, I had to teach Ross my bit because I actually didn't get a callback.
(Happily) Yeah I did!
Well, unfortunately, I don't get many callbacks so
Who knows?
Oh this is great! I might actually get to play Ben's dad!
Man, this is gonna be kinda weird.
Hey Pheebs! (To the guys) Hey!
Ross good, I'm uh glad you're here. I wanna talk to you about something.

Well, I've been thinking about this whole commercial thing, y'know me going up against Ben, the two of us competing, and that can't lead to anything good. So, I think I'm just gonna step aside. I'm gonna tell them that I won't audition.
That's it? You're-you're gonna let me do this?! This-this is my career we're talking about here!
I just said that so you wouldn't let Ben do it! Look Ross, if anyone should step aside it should be Ben!
What? Chandler! Tell 'em!
At least I care about his feelings!
Do you know how hard this is gonna be on him when he doesnt get it?
Oh, come on! Have you seen what my kid can do?! Huh?! I mean he dials phones! He-he-he eats tortilla chips! He-he plays soccer with the cartoon tiger!
You just give him a spoon baby!
Yeah! Because this commercial belongs to me and Mitch!
Yeah?! So's yours!
Hmmm, soup! (Tries again.) Hmm soup! (Tries again, with a little caveman thrown in.) Hmm, soup!
Oh yeah, no problem.

(goes over to Ben) Hi Ben! So you wanna be an actor huh? I gotta tell ya, it's no picnic. There's tons of rejection. No stability. One day you're Dr. Drake Remoray, the next day you're eating ketchup right out of the bottle.
(angrily) Ross!
Hi!
Uh-oh.
Well this is noodle soup and uh, I've been working with tomato. But that's okay, no problem. No problem. Hmm, noodle soup.
Oh, what did I say?
How's that different? (She looks at him until he gets it.) Oh! Yeah!
Hmm, noodle soup.
Okay.
Hmm, soup. (Pause.) I mean, noodle soup. I mean soup!
No! No! I-I can do it one more time! See? Look! (Eats another spoonful) Hmm, noodle soup. Damnit! (Storms out.)
Hey.
Yeah right! (Gets up for a refill to his snow cone.)
Yeah? Well look Ross, you don't have to. Okay? It's not your fault I suck. I mean what kind of an actor can't even say, "Hmm, noodle soup." (Nods his head in disgust.)
What you do mean?
Wait-whoa-whoa, you lost me.
Well, you're way sounds a lot better than mine. (Thinks about it.) Yeah. Yeah! It's not that I'm a bad actor
No, it's just ah, I care so damn much about little Ben that uh, it was more important to see him succeed.
Thank you! So, did-did he get it?
Eh, what are you gonna do?
(entering, with his grandmother) Hey everybody, look who's here! You remember my grandmother!
Chandler, she doesn't understand a word of English.
She's my biggest fan. Yeah, she's the only one in the family that's believed in me.
Yeah, I uh weighted like 27 pounds when I was born so
Wow Pheebs, you speak Italian?
Okay, see that blind guy right there? I'm gonna bash his head in later.
Oh umm, my big scene is coming up. Big scene coming up.
(walking past) True story! (Goes and sits down.)
Okay, here's my big scene. My big scene's here! (They have two of the cops on the street, then they cut to where they're entering an apartment.) Oh my God.
(smiling) Okay, everybody just keep smiling. It'll kill my grandmother if she finds out.
(smiling) Oh, they cut me out of the show.
(smiling) Not likely. 'Cause you see that body bag right there
(smiling) I'm in it.
(smiling) I don't know. This little, old lady lives for my career. When they dumped me off of Days of Our Lives she almost died.
(smiling) No, smile! Not that face, smile! Everybody smile! (They all smile.)
Soon, soon, I'm gonna be on soon. There I am! (Points to the screen, of course it isn't him.)
No-no-no, that-that's me, that's me.
(To Ross in the kitchen) All right, it's another commercial; I still haven't told her!
I know, I know! What am I going to do? (Thinks) Ooh!
(dejected) Yeah, all right. (Thinks of something.) Ooh! (He quickly runs out before anyone can stop him.)
(entering) Hey! Is the show still on?
(says hi to his grandma) Look! Oh! (Pointing out the window.) Is that the Pope?! (Chandler and his grandma turn to look and Joey slips a tape into the VCR.)
Oh, here I am, here's my big scene!
(on the tape) All right back off! I gotta gun! I'm not afraid to use it!
That's right!

(on the tape) Now, I wanna a suitcase filled with 100,000 dollars. (The duck quacks, to the duck) Choo! Choo! Choo! (To the imaginary cops) Filled with $100,000 in small bills, and if I don't get it(the duck quacks louder) Choo!! And if I don't get it, (pause, picks up the duck) I'm gonna shoot this duck!
(on the tape) I'm comin' out! (He opens the door and hops out pointing the gun in all directions and then runs out of view.)
(to his grandmother) That's uh, scenes from next week's show. Next week's!
Oh, yeah, good idea.
Ooh, Ross, look! Look! (Points behind Ross.)
Right over there! Right there! Look-look-look!
(to the rest of the gang) Somebody help me out here!
You got to go on a ride along?!
I want to go on a ride along!
(returning from a deli) Okay, I got it! This place makes the best sandwich in the world!
Oh-ho, yeah!
Yep!
(dejected) Yeah okay. (To Chandler) Even though my tax dollars paid for this car.
Yeah, okay.
Did I say you could smell it?!
Half the taste is in the smell! You-you're sucking up all the tastiness!
Okay, imagine the best sex you've ever had.
Are you thinking about Monica?
Yeah, what's that like?
Come on man! (To Gary) Listen so uh, are you gonna squeeze the perps shoes a little bit before he lawyers up?
Oh what? Like your Mr. Cop!
Yeah, what's up with that Serpico?
Is everything okay?
(To Ross) You okay man?
Hi.
Yeah, I didn't know that.
Cut it out Ross! I hate to have to save your life and kick your ass in the same day!
Dude! How come you took off?
Is something wrong?
Okay.
That's what this is about! Oh my God, you hate Ross!
Of course you do! I saved him! You're mad at me! It all adds up! You want Ross out of the picture.
I don't know, but I don't like what I'm hearing!
Ohh, you're upset because you think I chose Ross over you! No! Iknewyou could take care of yourself. Y'know, I mean Ross, he need help. He's not street like us!
Well, no, not exactly! All right, look, I, I wasn't trying to save Ross. Okay? My sandwich was next to Ross. All right? I was, I was trying to save my sandwich.
I know it doesn't make much sense
Look Chandler, it was instinct! Okay? I just went for it!
I know it sounds crazy, but Chandler this is (Goes and picks up the sandwich) the greatest sandwich in the world!
No! I would never do that! You-you're like my brother!
Yeah! In fact, to prove how much you mean to me, (He unwraps the sandwich and holds it out for Chandler) here.
No, eh, oh-oi, easy, it's not a hot dog!
How good is that?
See?
Oh-whoa-hey, dude, what are you doing?!
Yeah. With a bite! (Takes back the sandwich.) Gee-e-e-eez!
Yeah, hero sandwiches. (Points at Ross who points back.)
Hey Ross, is uh, is Staten Island really an island?
Ohhh. I thought it was like Long Island.
Hey, what time is it?
Wow! You realize that we've been throwing this ball, without dropping it, for like an hour?
Yeah. I realized it about a half-hour ago but I didn't want to say anything 'cause I didn't want to jinx it.
Oh, I-I, I think that's the first time I ever missed a meal! (Checks his pants.) Yeah, my pants are a little loose!
Hey!
What the hell is that?!!
That, is not a cat! {I have to agree with Joey on this one.}
It's not a cat!
It's not a cat!
Uhh, the ball thing.
Hey Ross, wouldn't it be great if we could go two straight hours without dropping it?!
Okay!
(catches the ball) Uh-oh.
I have to pee. And Rachel's in the bathroom!
Man, I didn't think we were gonna make it!
Maybe this should be more of a quiet game.
Hi!
I don't know.
Oh, I don't know. Yeah, can't do it.
Yeah, we haven't dropped it in (Looks to Ross.)
Oh, don't worry, it's not a cat.
That's right baby.
Oh yeah, that's right!
Whoa-whoa you guys, it's not a cat!
I don't know who made you the boss? All right? We (Ross and him) invented this game!
Did you get your money back?
Oh hey, here Pheebs. (He throws her the ball.)
Man that was great! Huh? Can you believe how long we threw that ball around?
Uhhh, mine too! Yeah.
Me too! Me too! Me too! (Yeah, he does the same thing.)
Yeah, I got too excited!
(entering, depressed) Hey. I just got off the phone with Estelle and guess what. (Pause, then very excitedly) I GOT THE LEAD IN A MOVIE!!!!!!

It's called Shutter Speed, it's really cool! Yeah, umm, I meet this girl in the subway and we fall in love in like a day, right? And then, she disappears But I find out where she lives and when I get there this like old lady answers the door and I say, Where's Betsy?" Right? And she says, "Betsy's been dead for 10 years."
And the best part is, we're filming in the desert outside Vegas! (To Chandler) And you know what that means buddy!
Road trip! Yeah, we can rent a car! I just have to be there by Tuesday!
All right! Thanks Pheebs!
Oh umm, not go.
I can't decide which route to take to Vegas. Hey, you've traveled a lot right?
Okay, so-so which route should I take the northern route or the southern route?
Great! Problem solved!
Well, back to square one.
(quickly) Yes!
Peanut butter!
A swimmer!
Monica. Oh huh, I always thought it would be Rachel.
Ascot!
North route!
Wow! That was incredible! Beard of bees, here I come!
Hey man, what's up?
Sure, what do you want to see?
Oh, I know how we can decide. Phoebe, show him your game!
I don't know. But hey, I know we can decide. Okay, I'm gonna ask you questions and you answer real quick. Okay?
What do you like better action or comedy?
Who would you rather sleep with Monica or Rachel?
Oh, I'm sorry. I forgot you had that whole Rachel thing.
Hey! You ready to go?
Man, I wish Ross was coming with us! Y'know? I'm gonna miss him!
Uh no, not really. It's an independent film y'know? So we don't have a real big budget. I figured I'd just stay in your room.
Oh yeah! For every dollar Shutter Speed makes, one penny of it goes right in Joey's pocket.
Did you not hear the plot of the movie? "She's been dead for ten years." I'm gonna be a millionaire!
Hey!
You got it!
Bye-bye!
Anybody want to say good-bye to me at the car?
See ya! (Walks out.)
Man, I'm getting pretty tired. You're might have to take over soon.
Don't worry, it's out there! (Just then a horn honks and Joey quickly looks at the road.) I think I just need lunch.
You wanna eat? (Pulls out the twenty) My treat!
Yeah. Okay. Ross's treat! Where do you wanna eat?
Ooh, hey, I know how we can decide! All right, uh, I'm gonna ask you a bunch of questions and then you have to answer real fast. Okay? So uh, clear your mind Clear it right out! Clear it out! Clear!
Okay, uhh, would you rather be too wet or too dry?
Do you believe in ghosts, yes or no?
Is this movie gonna be my big break?
(shocked) What?!
Dude you said, "No!"
You don't think this is going to be a big break for me?
I don't believe this!
What are you talking about?! I'm the lead in a movie!
Y'know what? I don't need this! Okay? I don't know why you're dumping all over my big break.
Is that why you're on this trip, huh? Make me feel like a loser? 'Cause if it is, I'll tell ya, I-I-I'd rather be alone.
Not if you're gonna be like this!
Yeah! I don't want you on the trip!
Fine! (He slams on the brakes, stopping the car on the bridge to the sound of numerous car horns.) Get out!
Get out!!
(on a pay phone holding a box) Not as upset as he's gonna be when he finds out what I did with his sweater vests!
Let's just say there's a well-dressed pack of dogs in Ohio. Hey Monica listen is-is Phoebe there? I gotta ask her something about the car.
Hey Pheebs! Listen, this wooden box keeps sliding out from under the seat. What-what is it?
Hey-hey! Stanley! Hey-hey! You're leading man is here! Let's get to work.
Wh-what?! Why?!
(laughs) You're kidding right?
What?!
Uh, hang out?! How long?
No!
Yeah.
Thanks. (The grip walks away.) (Reading the card.) Congratulations on your big break.
(on phone from Vegas) Hey Monica, it's Joey!
Aw, come on! It'll be years before I forget you!
Uh, well yeah-yeah, I've got all of that going on. Yeah, listen uh, I want you to make sure you tell Chandler that he couldn't have been more wrong! Uh-oh! I gotta go Monica, my uh, my sushi's here!
(to the family) Sorry about that. Thanks for waitin'.
Everybody smile! (The picture is taken) Okay, thanks a lot! Enjoy your stay at Caesar's! We hope it's toga-rrific! (The family leaves.) Kill me. Kill me now.
Hey Pheebs! Listen, uh can you do me a favor? I forgot the pin number to my ATM card can, can you get it for me?
Uh, I scratched it on the ATM machine down on the corner.
That's it! Thanks Pheebs!
No! (She nods no to Chandler) Because he didn't believe in my movie! Which is a big mistake because it is real! Real!
Uhh, my stunt double. Yeah, and y'know, he's getting a little too familiar for my tastes.
Uhh Pheebs, I heard that. Can you put him on?
Don't come out here!
I got that! I forgive ya! Don't come out here!
Well, I'm totally over it Chandler. Friends forever! Don't come out here!
Uh, Entertainment Tonight. [Cut to Chandler] Yeah, okay so, good talking to ya and don't come out here. All right. (Hangs up the phone and poses for that picture.)
Hi!
What-what are you guys doing here? I thought I told you not to come.

Uhh, because I'm shooting a scene right now. Yeah, I uh, I play a gladiator. Uh, y'know what? Hold-hold on a second. (To no one in particular) Can we cut? Yeah, my-my friends are here, I'm gonna take a little break.
They uh director. Uhh, her. (Points to an old woman standing behind him. Who glares at him and walks off.) All right, all right, it's not a gladiator movie. I work here.
Well, the movie got shutdown because they ran out of money, so I'm working here 'til it starts up again, if it ever does.
Look, I'm sorry I didn't tell ya. (To Chandler) I'm sorry man.
Yeah, what-what's going on?
Dawson?!
Aww, there we go.
Ooh, so close.
Whoa! Whoa! Guys! Please! Come on! Come on! This is obviously just a big misunderstanding.
Hey-hey don't look at me! I just work here! (Walks away.)
Hey, y'know in Roman times this was more than just a hat.
Yeah, sure! Sure! They would uh, they would scrub the floors with it! They would use it to get the mud off their shoe. And sometimes underneath the horse would get dirty so they would stick it right
All right well, I'll take you someplace nice then. Look! A guy tipped me a hundred bucks today.
Yeah-yeah, he was playing blackjack for like an hour and he won $5,000. Can you believe that? $5,000!
Wait a minute! Why don't I do what that guy did? I'll take this $100 and turn it into $5,000! And then I'll turn that into enough money to get my movie going again!
Chandler! I don't need luck. I have thought this through!
(to the dealer) Can I change a hundred? (He hands him his chip.)
(betting all 100) Let's ride.
Hit me! (He does so.) Ohh man! (Joey busts and loses all the money, but when the dealer starts to collect the cards Joey notices something.) Wait! (He holds his hand next to the dealer's hand.)
Chandler! You are not gonna believe this! I have found my identical hand twin!
My identical hand twin!
What's it sound like? It's a guy with my identical hands! It was incredible! Chandler, the dealer's hands were exactly like me! It-it was like looking at my hands in a mirror!
Dont you see what this means?! I can forget about that stupid movie. I'm gonna be a millionaire!
Look, I don't have it all worked out yet, but it's gotta mean big money! Come on! Identical hands!
This is Vegas man! People will pay to see freaky stuff! Okay, how much would you pay to see this hand (Holds up his left hand) twice? Huh?
Hey, are you unsupporting me again?
Pheebs!!
I found my identical hand twin!
(entering) Hey-hey-hey you made it!
All right! Hey-hey!
Who's your friend? He's hot! (Ross laughs and Rachel smacks him with her purse.)
No, don't be sorry. I don't need it anymore. I found my identical hand twin!
My identical hand twin! The person whose hands are exactly like mine! This thing is a gold mine!
Okay. Well, if that's how you feel about it, fine! None of you get to live with me in my great big hand-shaped mansion! Except uh, you Pheebs. You can live in the thumb.
(entering) Uhh, hey. Where's the other guy?
He's kinda tall, dark hair, hand looks exactly like this. (Holds up his hand.) See?
Okay! (Walks away, then turns back.) How you doin'?
Right! Okay. (Heads for the bathroom.)
Oh-oh-oh, yeah! (He grabs some towels and takes them to him.) That's right, you take good care of those babies!
It's me, Joey!
(holds up his hand) Joey!
Okay, so what are we going to do about this hand twin thing?!
Look, you and I have been given a gift. Okay? We have to do something with it. Like-like, hand modeling! Huh? Or-or magic! And you know NASA's gonna wanna talk to us!

(stopping him) Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa-whoa! We could have our own show! Y'know we could clap our hands together people will love it! Huh? And-and-and I wrote a song for us! (Singing, to the tune of This Land is Your Land) This hand is your hand! This hand is my hand! Oh wait, that's your hand! No wait, it's my hand!
(following him) But you haven't even heard the chorus!
Hey!
Hi!
Look-look-look you guys, I need some help! Okay? Someone is going to have to convince my hand twin to cooperate!
Yeah! I'm fine! Thanks! (He starts to leave, but gets an idea and stops.) Hey Rach, how you doin'?
Ross, don't let her drink anymore! (Exits)
(sitting down) Ahhh! (Slides his hands across the table.)
No-no, I don't really have any money. Not yet, anyway (Shakes his hands.)

(throws down a small wad of money, and as his hand twin starts to unfold it, Joey once again brings attention to their special gift to the world. {Y'know, looking at it now, they really don't have that similar of hands. Joey's are bigger.}) Ooh-ho-ho! (The dealer stares at him and he stops.)
Hit me! (He does so.)
Uhh, Ms. Phalange, may I ask you a question as an impartial person at-at this table?
Wouldn't you pay good money to see these identical hands showcased in some type of a uh, entertainment venue?
Me?! Oh come on, man! You can't do this! Come on! (Being dragged out by the guard) I'm your hand twin!!
(entering with Phoebe) Come on Pheebs! Hurry! Hurry! Hurry! Hurry!
Hey!
Ross and Rachel left us a message saying they were getting married! Isnt that why you guys are here?
Well! What happened?! Did we miss it?
Mornin Pheebs. (Sits down.) Well, my movie has officially been canceled.
Nah, Im too depressed to eat. Ill probably eat in like 5 minutes. So I guess Ill just fly home with you guys, what times your flight?
I dont need that anymore.
I dont want to drive all the way back by myself, I get so lonely. (Gets an idea.) Ohooh! How about you come with me?
Itll be great! We-we could talk, and play games! Huh? This could be our chance to like renew our friendship.
Sure?
Hey.
Where is the waitress?! Im starving!
Oh, heres where I win all my money back! (Gets up and heads for the buffet table with Chandler in tow.)
Sure! Whats up? (He grabs a plate and proceeds to load it with a huge pile of scrambled eggs. Chandler just stares at him and Joey reluctantly gives him a spoonful.)
Oh my God! Thats huge! (Hugs him.) Wait a minute, why come I wasnt invited? And who was going to be your best man? Dont say, "Ross." Do not say, "Ross."
Oh! Tell her shes not marriage material.
Girls say it to me all the time! And believe me, if shes anything like me, shes just gonna be relieved.
They let you get married when youre drunk! Most people who get married in Vegas are drunk!
An annulment? Ross! I dont think surgerys the answer here.
(wakes up) What?!
All right. All right.
Really? I dont
(starts singing) I wanna rock and roll all night! (Falls asleep.)
(to himself) Man, this is a long drive! Are my eyes open? No! (He opens his eyes and sees a hitchhiker.)
Dont you think I asked him that before he got in?!
Ooh, Ill play! Ill play!

Come on Pheebs! I cant take this anymore! Let-let me make it up to you. Huh? (Starts singing.) Ground control to Major Tom. Commencing countdown, engines on. Take your protein pills and put your helmet on!

Pheebs, I am so sorry! I know I promised you a fun road trip with your friend and I didnt deliver. But-but-but now I know that you think being awake is an important part of friendship! So, so, so I will strive to-to stay awake for as long as I know you.
Well, thank you. So, can we play 20 Questions now? Ive got a really good one! Ive been thinking about it since Kansas.
Yes.
That is incredible! You are the master!
What are you doing?
I can fix it. Hold on. (He goes and gets a screwdriver from his apartment) Look out. Look out. (Pries at the door a little bit.)
Im not finished.
(entering) Hey Monica!
(To Chandler) Hey man, you feeling any better? (Chandler answers him with some guttural sounds that only he can make and that no human can transcribe.)
Oh my God! Youre pregnant!
Wow! (Tearing up) Well, uh Hey! Im really happy for you guys! Congratulations! (Kisses Monica on the cheek) See you later. (Starts for the door on the verge of tears as Monica stops him.)
Yeah, I gotta go! I got an acting job. (Turns towards the door, pauses, and turns back.) Like youd believe that. This sucks!

(To Monica) Okay! Look-look-look, uh, if youre gonna be moving in with him I feel its my responsibility to tell you the truth about him! Okay? Hes a terrible roommate! Terrible! He uh, forgets to umm Oh-oh he always, he always ummOh, who am I kidding! Hes the best roommate ever! (Hugs Chandler.)
God, its gonna so weird like when I come home and youre not here. Yknow? No more Joey and Chans. No more J and Cs. "You wanna go over to Joey and Chandlers?" "Cant, its not there."
Yeah but we wont be able to like get up in the middle of the night and have those long talks about our feelings and the future.
Hi.
Hey! I did not cry my eyes out!! Come on! Its like the end of an era! No more J-man and Channies!!
So, Ross and Rachel got married, Monica and Chandler almost got married, do you think you and I should hook up?
Really?! Well, when?
Wow.
Great!
Oh-oh, what about Ross?
(To Chandler) Dude! What are yoyou trying to kill me?!
Hey, what is with the secrecy Phoebe? Huh? And what about this Denise, is she cute?
Hey Rach, listen I was thinkin uh, Im gonna have an extra room over at my place
Yeah, why dont you move in with me? Itll be great! We could stay up late, watch movies, and you know about Naked Thursdays right?
Hey! (To Chandler) Dude, some guy just called for you.
I dont know! How about, "Thanks for taking the message." Jeez! (Exits.)
Hey, whats up?
But youre still moving in together, right? Because my ad came out today. (Shows him the paper.)

Yeah? I just figured yknow, after living with you itd be an interesting change of pace to have a female roommate, yknow? Someone I can learn from, someone-someone whos different than me. And whats more different than me; a guy whos not 19 than say a girl who is 19? Enh? (Points to his head.) Not just a hat rack my friend!

(exiting from Chandlers room with the new roommate) Everything on your application looks really goodOhh! Just one last question umm, are you and your friends gonna be over here all the time like partying and hanging out?
Whoa!! Now look, dont be just blurtin stuff out. I want you to really think about your answers. Okay?
Oh dont listen to him, hes just some guy who really wants the apartment, but I dont think hes gonna get it.
That thing was a hazard! (To the potential roommate) Im very safety conscious.
Umm, listen, Ross do you really think this moving in with Rachel is a good idea?
Yeah well, maybe you should go back! Okay? Rachel moves in, and before you know it youre right where you dont want to be! Back together!
Thats not gonna work out! Then shes gonna come home all weepy and youll be tellin her, "Oh thats okay. Youll find someone." And then, bamn! She finds you!
I am telling you Ross, she is definitely gonna fall in love with you again! Now, is that what you want?
Here she comes. Hold on, Im gonna make your life much easier.
Or not. Uh, Rach, why dont you just move in with me? (Rachel sighs.)
No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no Its okay, I mean Ilook Rach, I know I scared you off with that whole Naked Thursdays thing, but we dont have to do that!
Thursdays clearly not good for ya, pick a day!
(opening the door to The Potential Roommate) Hi!
Come in. Thanks for comin back, umm, okay there have been a lot of people interested in the room, but I have narrowed it down and you are one of the finalists!

Okay now, before I make my final decision I uh, I just want to make sure our personalities match. Okay, so I made up a little test. Now, Im gonna say a word and then you say the first thing that comes to mind.
Okay! Here we go. Pillow.
Very good! Okay. G.
Excellent! Okay umm, doggy.
Ooh, sorry! No-no-no, so close though, butbye-bye! (He ushers her out the door.)
I cant believe she would say that too you.
(interrupting him) Uh Ross! Are there uh, are there naked chicks on that piece of paper?
Well, Ive just never seen a guy stare so hard at a piece of paper that didnt have naked chicks on it.
Oh-ooh-ooh! Yknow whats a good visual aide?
Why not?!
Hey! Any good mail?
Ooh, its probably a residual check, hey can you open it for me, Im kinda.
Hmm thats weird. I dont remember being in a move called benefits lapsed.
Let me see that!
(reads it) Oh, I cant believe this! This sucks! When I had insurance I could get hit by a bus or catch on fire, yknow? And it wouldnt matter. Now I gotta be careful?!
All right well, I guess I gotta go get a job. Im gonna go see my agent.
(mocks him, in a whiney voice) look both ways before you cross the street. (Turns and walks headlong into the closed door.)
(entering) Hey Estelle, listen
What are you talkin about? I never left you! Youve always been my agent!
Yeah!
Estelle, you gotta get me some work. I-I lost my health insurance.
Why?
Bastard!
(in obvious pain) Hey! So Estelle lined up a bunch of auditions for me tomorrow and Ill have my health insurance back in no time.
What?!

Nothing! Well, I-I got this blinding pain in my stomach when I was lifting weights before, then I uh passed out and uh, havent been able to stand up since. But um, I dont think its anything serious.
No way! Kay look, if I have to go to the doctor for anything its gonna be for this thing sticking out of my stomach! (Rolls over and shows Chandler.)
Why did I have to start working out again? (Looks at the weights he was using.) Damn you 15s!
Dude! Hernia operations cost like, a lot probably. Besides its getting darker and more painful, that means its healing.

Thank you, but it would take me forever to pay you that money back and I dont want that hanging over my head. Okay? Besides, as soon as my insurance kicks in I can get all the free operations I want! Yeah, Im thinking Ill probably start with that laser eye surgery too.
Hey!
Look, Im telling you if I put my hand on my stomach right here (He puts his hand down his pants, like Al Bundy on MarriedWith Children always used to do.) it doesnt hurt that bad.
Sure, now Im scared.
Yeah, but I dont wanna die!
(in a gravely, painful voice) Okay. "Hey, Timmy, Ive got a surprise for you."
Oh yeah, sure, no problem, Ill justhold on one second. (He turns around and puts his hand in his pants and groans in relief.) (In a relaxed voice.) "Hey Timmy, Ive got a surprise for you!"
So thats why I feed my dog Purina One! Pick up a bag today! (He turns, looks at the bag and realizes he wont be able to pick it up.)
Exactly.
Or, I could just point to it! Huh? Blah, blah, blah, Purina One, point to a bag today. (She just looks at him.) I didnt get it, did I?
Yeah, okay. (Leaves)
Hi. Im Joey Tribbiani; Im here to audition for (Groans) man.
Yes!
(barely audible through the pain) Thank you.
Yeah! And hey, thanks for coming with me. And thanks again for helping me take a shower.
(to the director) Hiya!
Hi Alex! (to the director) And uh, as you can see my hands are not in my pants. (Holds them both up.)

Take could care of your Momma son. (Alex just looks at him and the director motions for him to continue so he tries it again.) "Take could care of your Momma son." (Alex does nothing.) "Come on son! Your Mommas good people!"
Ah, just one thing umm, is it all right with you if I, if I scream right up until you say action?
Okay. (Starts screaming.)
(he stops screaming at action) "Take good care of your Momma son." (Again Alex does nothing.)

Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! You just take a big, big swing. Now, dont hold back. (He dons his protective helmet (Why, I have no clue.) and Phoebe picks up a wooden baseball bat and starts to swing as Chandler and Monica enter.)
Hey-hey-hey!

Oh! Hey, somebody left their keys. (Looks at them) Ooohh, to a Porsche! {Transcribers note: Oh come on! Who would leave the keys to their Porsche behind? If I had a Porsche, Id have the keys surgically attached to my hand!} Hey Gunther, these yours?
Na-uh! (To everyone there) Hey did anybody lose their keys?
Theres a lost and found? (Gunther sets the box up on the table.) My shoe! (Grabs it out of the box.)

Well, I didnt realize until I got home. I wasnt gonna walk all the way back down here with one shoe! Yknow what? Im gonna go find that guys car and leave a note on the windshield. (Goes to do so.)
Great! Thanks. (Exits.)
Yeah, its not mine.
Yeah, its (looks up and sees the woman) mine.
Me too! Yeah. And comfortable. Do uh, do you like leather seats?
(checks in the window to make sure it has them) Its got em!
(entering) Hey guys!
Hey babies! Oh, Im having the best morning. That uh, that Porsche Ive got the keys too, still there!
You should see the treatment I get when Im with that car! People are friendly; they-they wanna talk, and not just about the car! One guy gave me advice about my equity investments.

The ones that got me the Porsche! Will you keep up! (Chandler wipes his forehead with a baby wipe, that might have been used. He drops it disgustedly.) But I figured, if-if people keep seeing me just standing there, theyre gonna start to think that I dont own it. So I figured Ill wash it. Right? Monica, you got a bucket and some soap I can borrow?
Yeah, she tops out at 130.
And thats just in the city. I get her up to 160 when I take her upstate.
Sure!
Okay, take it easy.
Really? Oh uh, oh just give me five more minutes with it.
Oh I-I uh, found the keys and now Im just polishing her up.
Yeah, but its my wax.
Sure. Here. (He hands them over.) Ill uh, save your parking spot.
Why not?
Yeah, so did I.
(entering wearing nothing but Porsche clothes) So the Porsche guy took his car back.
No. No, I just uh, I just loved the way it feels when everybody thinks I own a Porsche.
Of course! Only an idiot would wear this stuff if you didnt have the car! Right?
Oh, Ive been there. Yeah, I am gonna go drive my Porsche. (Starts to leave.)
Come on! What are you doing?! Im in character! Would you talk to her! (Storms out.)
Why isnt that valet back with my Porsche?
(to women passing him) Porsche.
Hi! How are the Gellers?
Hey! Its Porsche!! (Hes right yknow.)
Hey! Hey! Be careful around my Porsche!
Hey! How you doin?

Id love to show ya, but I just tucked her in. Shes sleeping. (The women both laugh) Hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink? (Just then the same guy with the football dives to make a catch, lands on the car cover, and collapses it. It turns out that Joey set up a bunch of boxes to make it look like a Porsche.)
Right! And when is that due?
And thats every month?
Ahhh.
(looking at it) Oh my God!!
No-no! No way! Joey Tribbiani does not take charityanymore.
No! Forget it! OkayI mean thanks, but Im done taking money from you. All right, I can take of myself. Now, whats next? Come on.
This is how much we pay for electric?!!!
Hey!
I dont know Ross, not if youre gonna talk about how you gave up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist.
(quietly) Ive got Ben.
Here it is! Our last pizzas together as roommates.
Oh thats okay. Hey, actually in a way its kinda nice. Me, bringing the food of my ancestors, you, the food of yours!
What, are you crazy? You havent beaten me once since my injury plagued 97 season. It would be easier if you just give me your money.
Okay, youre on.

(scores) Yes! I win again! Ha-ha! Thats like 500 bucks you owe me! Whoo-ho-hoo! (Goes over to the fridge and starts opening and closing the door rapidly.) $500 that is a loooot of electricity! (By the way, theres nothing in the fridge.) Whoo-ho-ho! (Notices the sparseness of the fridge.) I gotta buy some food.
You serious?
Okay, get ready to owe me!
Okay, here we go. Ready?
This sucks man! The last night youre here and I lose the two most important things in my life, the foosball table and $500.
Nah, not my game.
Well, whats it called?
I dont know how to play Cups.
All right.
A two and a five.
Really?!
A four and a nine.
No. Why?
Damn! I am good at Cups!
Well, what did you have?
Uh, (counts the money) wow, 700.
Yeah.
What?
Really?

Rachel, would you stop saying that?! Hey-hey look, remember on the show when-when Caprice was dying and she gave me
Wow! Uh okay, well uh (He gets up, opens a drawer, and pulls out the ring.)
Sure! As long as they dont find out you can keep whatever you want! And I want you to have it.
Yes! Yes!! And every time you look at it, I want you to remember that you are a good person. Okay, youve had the chance to cheat, and with me, but you didnt. And thats what this ring stands for.
Look, do you want the ring or not?!
Hey!
All right!
Whoa-whoa-whoa! Youre not gonna use the pay phone to call work, are ya?
(not quite sure of how to answer that) Well uh, look Ross I uh, I think Carols great and Im sure youre a very attractive man, but I.
You?
Wow!
All right! So, was it amazing?
Just okayDid you do it right?!
Huh. But still Ross, youre worst day with two women, pretty much better than any other day! Yknow what I mean?
But you got to be with both of them, right?
Not the other one?
Yeah, you dont want that.
Well hey, at least you got to see a lot of stuff, right?
You got a little bored?
Yeah? What did ya have?
Sounds good.
(hes just picked up their bill) Hey! So, whats with the 20 percent tip? Did I do something wrong?
Yknow whats more generous than that?! Fifty percent! Yknow whats even more generous than that?!!

All right, look Im sorry you guys, but its just that I gotta get these new head shots made. And theyre really expensive, yknow? Im down to like three! Well, actually two cause one of em I kinda blackened in some teethWhy did I do that?! (Hits himself in the head.)
Oh, ha-ha-ha! Ooh! Wait a minute, I used to get medical experiments down on me all the time!

No-no! I used to get paid for all kinds of medical stuff, remember? Lets see uh, well I dont want to donate sperm again. (To Ross) I really prefer doing that at the home office yknow? (Ross nods his head.) Ooh-ooh, maybe they want like some of my blood or-or spit or something, huh?
Yeah?
Uhh do it?
Well, where was I? (Takes a sip of the coffee.)
Takes it out of you? (Laughs.)
Ohh, hey! Why dont you book a date for both of you at one of those romantic spas?
And of course, crotchless panties.
You cant make crotchless panties? You take, you take a pair of scissors and you just cut
(to the receptionist) Hi uh, Im Joey Tribbiani and with all do respect Id like to donate some fluids.
Oh thats too bad. Ive kinda been saving up. (She just looks at him in horror.) Uh, are you sure theres no studies I can participate in?
Thanks. (Starts to read it.) Well but this one starts now. (Points to one.)
But its $2,000.
Well how about this one? Testing the effects of Joey Tribbiani on attractive nurse receptionists.

(in his head) 2,000 bucks is a lot of money. Oh, I wish I had a twin. Where could I find someone who looks exactly like me? (The camera widens its shot to reveal a room full of Joey look-a-likes. Joey looks at the guy next to him and then back at his script.)
(entering) No! No! No! No! No! How you doin?! How you doinDamnit Carl! Go wait in the hall! (Goes into the hall.)
Look, I got to apologize on the behalf of Carl.
Oh, did I not mention? Carl is a guy I hired to be my identical twin for a medical research project.
Okay, I know it sounds crazy, but I think it might work. Yknow? The only problem is, Carls acting is (Does the international hand symbol for so-so.)
Yeah, hes the reason I didnt get that big Minute Maid commercial a couple of years ago remember? We were supposed to be brothers, but he messed it up.
(to Carl) Pizza!! We like Pizza!! Get out!!! (Carl does so.)
All right Carl, were next. Now remember, what is not gonna be?
Thats right! And what are you not gonna do?
(gets very angry) Damnit Carl! (Carl goes to say something more, and Joey silences him with a grunt.)
Thats us.
Thats right, $2,000.
Damnit Carl!
Oh hey, do you still have their final exams?
Oh, cause you can just match the evaluation to the exam with the same handwriting and boom, theres your admirer. (Ross is stunned.)
Oh, well think of it like this, when youre 90
No thats not what I was going to say at all. No, what I was going to say is when youre 90 youll still have the memory of what it was like to be with a 20-year-old.
Hey Chandler! Yknow that girl you went to college with who-who became a movie director?
Oh well listen, anyway shes directing the new Al Pacino movie. You gotta get me an audition!
No-no-no, please-please Chandler I-I-I would owe you so much!
Hey-hey dude, why are you changing the subject? Why? Will you make the call or what?
All right! Thanks! Youre the best! Now listen, the last day of auditions is Thursday. Okay? So I gotta get in there by Thursday. Okay? Just remember Thursday. Thursday. Can you remember Thursday?
(angrily) Thursday! Look if you need help remembering think of like this, the third day. All right? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when? Huh? What day? Thursday! The third day! Okay?!
Okay.
The part I want to audition for is a fireman, this is so meant to be!
(to the fireman) Hey buddy, do you think I can borrow your uniform this Thursday?
Oh, how bad is it?
Chandler, is that (Mimes someone using a movie camera and Chandler nods yes.)
Hey-hey listen (Chandler waves him away.)
When youre off the phone, do you wanna get a pizza?
Hey listen, so whens-whens my audition? I mean I know its Thursday, but what time?
Ah-ha!
Hey, you wanna do Joey a favor, maybe you go out with Joey. (He turns around to see Chandler glaring at him.)
This right here is where I keep the pizza. (He points to the chair.) And uh thats where the napkin is. (Points to the floor next to the chair.)
I know! (Shrugs his shoulders.)
This is where I keep the pizza. (Its the same location as before.) AndHey! Where did the napkin go?! (The napkin is not in its spot.)

(in a funny voice) Yeah, so it turns out that it wasnt the hair straightener that started the fire. (Rachel prompts him on what to say next.) No-no, it was the candles. Its very not good leaving candles unattended. In fact, one of the first things they teach you in fire school is (Phoebe suddenly enters.) Uhh Uhh Okay. Well, I have to go now. (Phoebe leaves.)
Well Ross, it seems pretty clear. I mean whats more important? What people think or how you feel, huh? Ross, you gotta follow your heart.
Hey-hey-hey! So, how did it go with Dana? Any reason I should leave a block of time open say Thursday?
You couldnt do it?!
Ah whatever!
No thats all right. Dont worry about it.
Rach! Hey! Its fine! Youre at Joeys!
Yeah! Look! (He throws some of his spaghetti on the floor.)
I know.
All right, dont waste it, I mean its still food. (He picks it up and eats it.)
Hey, here you go. (Hands her another one.)

Oh, very funny. I dont know if you remember, but my audition was supposed to be Thursday. (Chandler doesnt say anything until Joey figures it out.) You got me the audition?! Lets hug it up! (They hug.)
Thats right, all the ladies want to stay at Joeys.
Yeah.
Hey!
So?

Wh? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when huh what? Thurs(He gasps in horror.) Oh! (Runs out and Chandler just shakes his head. After a second Joey runs back in to grab a piece of pizza and runs back out.)
Well that thing is clearing in the way! All right. Ah-ha! (He grabs a screwdriver and starts to attack the compressor, only he causes a small short circuit and shocks himself.) Ah-ah!! Damn fridge!
Great! Roomie!
Yeah! Well, now that you brought it up, our fridge is broken. We have to get a new one. Now, I checked around and your half is $400. Thanks a lot.
Look Rach, my parents bought this fridge just after I was born, okay? Now, I have never had a problem with it. Then you show up and it breaks! What does that tell ya?
All right, now you know that the ATM will only lets you take out 300 at a time, Ill take a check for the other hundred.
Of course Im jokin! I dont take checks.
Oh, Im sorry. Thank you Chandler.
Ooh! So close.
Hey-hey come on you guys, give him a break. Ross, seriously, hows it going with her?
Huh.
The fridge broke. I have to eat everything. Cold cuts, ice cream, limesHey, what was in that brown jar?
Not anymore. So anyway, how do you want to pay me?
No! No! No! For my new fridgeour new fridge!
So what? Look, suppose we were a divorced couple.
And I got custody of the kid, right? Now suppose the kid dies and-and I gotta buy a new kid.
(pause) Give me $400!
Or! You can just, yknow (He walks up close to whisper in Rosss ear and when he gets there he pushes Ross into the fridge.)
What? What the hell am I doing? You just broke my fridge!
Oh-ho-ho, you think I dont know what breaks my fridge? Excuse me! (He opens the door and feels inside.) Well what do you know! Broken! Thatll be $400!
(pause) You pushed him!
All right. Chandler, do you remember how I told you about our fridge?
I still havent gotten a check for your half yet.
Im not talking to you! You broke my fridge!
(entering) Pheebs! There you are! Okay, you broke my fridge; you owe me 400 bucks!
Really?!
Call it even?
Man, she is going to have a great time! Is she staying at the Hotel Corona?
Sure! I was there! Spring Break 81! Woo-hoo!
So what? I drove down, sold T-shirts, had a blast. And yknow who knows how to party? Drunk college chicks.
(entering) Hey!
I just got this really weird message from Ross. He said turn on MTV.
Ahh, to be 13 again.
The reactors gonna blow in three seconds, were never gonna make it!
No! I wont leave you!
No youre not! Not to me!
What?
Yeah, youre great! Okay, lets take it from
Yeah, I thought I was pretty good too.
Yknow what? I think thats enough for now. Yeah. I dont want to be over rehearsed.

Oh, its a new TV show. Yeah. Im up for the part of Mac Macaveli or "Mac." Yeah, Im a detective and I solve crimes with the help of my robot partner. Hes a, hes a Computerized Humanoid Electronically Enhanced Secret Enforcer or-or "C.H.E.E.S.E."
Thats the title! Yeah! Yknow they really lucked out that the initials spell cheese.
Well, dont get your hopes up, because probably not gonna happen.
I mean come on you guys! My own TV show? I just dont know if Im good enough.
You really think so?
Yeah, and oh she's really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting.

It's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you're thinkin' of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this. (Does this intense look where it looks like he's smelling a fart.)

(there's a gunshot on TV) There's my scene, there's my scene. [Joey on tv] "Mrs. Wallace, I'm Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister's neurosurgeon. I'm afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from a..." (Does the smell-the-fart look.)
(on stage in an Austrian accent) Vell, Eva, ve've done some excellent vork here, and I vould have to say, your pwoblem is qviiite clear. (He goes into a song and dance number.)

I play Al Pacino's butt. All right? He goes into the shower, and then- I'm his butt. Monica: (trying not to laugh) Oh my God. Joey: C'mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino's in it, and that's big! Chandler: Oh no, it's terrific, it's- it's- y'know, you deserve this, after all your years of struggling, you've finally been able to crack your way into show business. Joey: Okay, okay, fine! Make jokes, I don't care! This is a big break for me! Ross: You're right, you're right, it is.
All right well, Im outta here. Wish me luck.
Yeah, whatever. (Exits.)
(entering, dejectedly) Hey.
Terrible! I messed up every line! I shouldnt even be an actor!
Yeah, did I fool ya?
Oh, it went amazingly well!
Yeah-yeah, its down to me and two other guys.
And I know both of them, theyre really good. One of them is the guy from those allergy commercials whos always getting chased by those big flowers
Im just so nervous! Yknow? The callback isnt until tomorrow at five. I feel like my head is going to explode!
Theres just so much pressure. I mean no offense, but what you guys do is very different. I dont know if youd understand.
I want this part so much! Yknow? If I dont get this part Im never gonna eat Macaroni and Cheese again!No, I didnt say that! Thats a lie.
Yes!! Ha-ha!! All right! Hey! How cool would it be if you could watch like a real life-sized version of this? Huh? I mean how crazy would that be?

(on phone) Hello? (Listens) What are you talking about? The auditions not til 5:00! (Chandler suddenly remembers and looks at the unfinished message then tries to sneak over and finish it as Joey listens.) Well, nobody told me! (Listens) Whod you talk to? (Listens and turns around to see Chandler trying to finish the message.) Nevermind! (Hangs up.)
The allergy guy got the part! Thanks!
How could you do this to me Chandler?! This part couldve turned my whole career around!
Hey, you dont even live here anymore! What are you doing answering my phone? I have my machine!
And what?! Did you sleep with her?!
What?!! Thats even worse!!
I dont know! But its the same!
Over the line?! You-youre-youre so far past the line, that you-you cant even see the line! The line is a dot to you!
Name one!
(getting out) Awww, man! He promised he wouldnt take the chairs!!
Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didnt think big enough to fit a grown man!
I was tryin to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what Im gonna do?
No way! I've been going to the guy for 12 years.
That's how they do pants! Ross, will you tell him? Isn't that how they measure pants?
I said name one!
Okay, buddy-boy. Here it is. You hide my clothes, I'm wearing everything you own.
Look at me! I'm Chandler! Could I be wearing any more clothes? Maybe if I wasn't going commando...
Yeah. Whew, it's hot with all of this stuff on. I ah, I better not do any, I don't know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)
Hey!
What message?
What?! Its 6 oclock!
I cant believe this Chandler!
Well you-you-you-you might say congratulations! I saw the board! I went to the audition! I got the part!!
Oh, well Im uh
Oh wow! Okay man, Im sorry. I did not mean to make you feel bad.
(shocked) Thats mean! You really had me going there!
Yeah, youre right. Okay look, listen, lets talk about what a huge star Im gonna be!
You hug me!
Hey, do we do this too much?
Yeah.
Come on C.H.E.E.S.E., Im not leaving without you! Try routing your backup source through your primary CPU.
Wow! (Back to reading the scene.) Well then Ill just have to carry you.
Ross, you dont have to yell.
Yknow what? I think thats enough for today. Thanks for your help! (He grabs their scripts and heads for his room.)
(entering) Hey guys!
Am I psyched? The lead in my own TV series? Ive dreamed about this for years! Why have I not been preparing?!

But I got to act with a robot Pheebs, and-and I dont know anything about technology! I cant even use Chandlers computer except to find porn! And-and thats only cause its right there when you turn it on!
Wow! Huh? (Picks up the phone) Mac Macaveli, Private Investigator!
Okay. Hey uh, when do I get to meet the robot?
Okay.
Oh wow! Hes so lifelike! (Starts touching the guys cheeks) Unbelievable! (He starts tugging on the guys ears.
(slaps Wayne on his cheek) How do you do there, Wayne? (Backs away.)
Okay. Sorry about that(Mimics that cheek thing he just did.) Uh, so wheres C.H.E.E.S.E.?
(laughs) This is like the temporary robot, right?
Well, I-I just, I just it was going to be like a really cool robot, yknow? Like the terminator or uh, when I first saw you.
Im sorry, it justI dont know it doesnt really look like it can do anything.
Hey!
Pretty great! Except I did get a little attitude from the robot.
Anyway, it wasnt the robot, it was the guy who controls him. Yeah, he doesnt like me. He had C.H.E.E.S.E. knock over the sandwich right when I was reaching for one! Ohh!
I may have to, I hate to do it, but Im the star! Yknow? Theres a limit to how many sandwiches I can eat off the floor. (His cell phone rings) Excuse me. (Answers it, on phone) Joey Tribbiani.
Wow!
Im the lead in Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.!!
Apparently, theres like a million guys out there that can play Mac, and theres only this one robot and this one guy who controls it! I didnt know he could get me fired! What am I going to do?
Thanks, but I kinda have a problem to deal with here.

Thats not a bad idea. Yeah. Okay, but if I got to turn on the charm tomorrow Im not wasting anymore of it over here with you guys. (Starts to leave, but stops and turns to Phoebe.) Well, actually I got a little bit saved for you Pheebs. (Exits.)
Morning! Hey, hows my favorite genius and my little robot buddy?! (Pats C.H.E.E.S.E. on the head.)

Okay! (He yanks his hand away.) All right. Umm, all right Wayne, level with me. Okay? I-I keep hearing all these rumors that I might get fired. Okay, they even have actors coming in to read for my part! Come on man, you-you got to give me a second chance! I mean, I love-I love this little guy! (He grabs C.H.E.E.S.E.s arm and pulls it off at the elbow.) Ah-ah!! (Wayne is shocked.) Okay, thats why you didnt want me to touch him right? Here you go! Okay? (Hands Wayne the arm and he goes to fix it. Meanwhile Joey starts to berate himself.) Stupid! I cant believe it! God! (A very beautiful woman walks by.) (To her) Hey, how you doin? (He and her go over to talk and Wayne looks on with envy.)
I cant believe Im going to lose this job!
Yeah! Help me get this mini-fridge past the security guard.
Yeah? Well, I dont want to talk to you Wayne! I hate you! You ruined my life! Oh, Chandler, Wayne. Wayne, Chandler. (They shake hands.)
(incredulous) Why should I help you?!
(happily) What do you need?
Yeah?
What are you in love with her or something?
Oh wow Wayne, its not really something you can teach yknow? Its pretty much something youre born with if you(Off Chandlers look)You-you can teach it! Ill show you right how to do it.
Well, it turns out you were right C.H.E.E.S.E.

You got it! And the rabbis beard, 100% horsehair. Nice catch C.H.E.E.S.E.! (Pauses as he waits for C.H.E.E.S.E.s next line.) Its your line C.H.E.E.S.E.! (Suddenly C.H.E.E.S.E. goes crazy and starts flinging its arms and advancing on Joey behind the desk.) Wayne! Wayne!!
(nodding knowingly) Now youre thinking you gotta sleep with him.
Me too.
Oh man! (Hits Chandler)
Hey Ross listen Chandler got you out of going to the lesbian sandwich museum this weekend!

I know. It was so cool when I was up there before. Me and Jim Belushi would just be crackin up about something Then I get fired off of Days Of Our Lives and he takes me down. Now hes just laughing at me. Look at him, that smug Belushi bastard, Ill
Hey! So Im back.

Joey Tribbiani! From the wall! (The dry cleaner doesnt remember) Okay, maybe this will jog your memory, huh? (Holds his picture up in front of his face.) Huh? Okay eh-ah-anyway, Im ready to go back up on the wall Im the star of a new TV show.
Oh well, its not on TV yet.
Okay, fine, I will bring you a tape, huh? (Walks away)
(entering) Hey! So, did you watch the tape of my show?
All right, lets get me back up there! (Holds out his picture.)
WhatBut you saw the show!
Dry cleaners?
Okay! Okay, look! You-you-you got Harrison Ford up there!
Okay well that may be true. But, in-in okay, Air Force One the Russians were terrorists! And evil! And plus he kills a bunch of them! That-that-thats offensive to Russians.
Oh you should, its great.
Uh yeah, where-wheres the guy who decides whos pictures go up on the wall?

Oh, youre kidding me! All-all right, well make sure you tell him that Joey Tribbiani stopped by to drop off all of these clothes. Okay? Im an actor; Im kinda getting my picture up there on the wall.
Oh really? Well, maybe you and I go out for drinks? (Pause) Youre the other one right? (She thinks about it for a second and nods yes.)
I didnt do that! Who wouldve done that?!
Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa, I-IHey! I did not go out with your wife! (The same woman from before enters.) Okay? I went out with her! (Points at her.)
Yeah.
Hey Gunther.
Oh uh, well I just came in for a cup of coffee to go.
No! No, I quit a long time ago. (Pause) Did I forget to you that one? Im sorry.
Great! (Takes his coffee and leaves.)
Hey. (Heads straight for the fridge.)
Oh, Im sorry. You wanna bite? (Holds his piece out for him.)
No.
Yeah.
Oh, were supposed to just get him a ticket?! That guy is always mooching off of us!
Oh wow thats a great idea! And I still have his credit card.

Hey-hey-hey-ho-ho, I got this one. Here you go. (Hands Gunther Chandlers card.) Yknow I gotta tell ya, sometimes I justI dont get Chandler. Yknow, me and him do stuff all the time without you and you dont get all upset.
All the time!
(entering) Hey!
Whoa-whoa-hey-hey! (Motions to Chandler, "Whats going on?") Hi, Paul is it? (Paul nods yes and still hugging Joey.)
Yes, its in my Inin my pocket. (Paul hasnt dropped him yet.) (Chandler starts to reach for his front pocket.) My back pocket! My back pocket!
Oh hey listen I got us tickets to a Knicks game tonight.
Come on! Itll be fun! Me, you, and Ross, and Paul probably
No! He blew us off!
I know!
Can I tell you something? Me too.
Ooooh! Freeze him out.
I like it!
From now on, its gonna be Joey and Ross, best friends. (They shake hands.) Okay! Were gonna be the new Joey and Chandler.
(To Ross) I think we gotta end the freeze out.
Oh my God!!
And-and-and-and-and-and, and were gonna be friends again!
Oh its water under the bridge, forget it!
I think Im gonna cry!
(holding an empty tissue box) Wheres all the tissues?! (Throws the box down in disgust.)
Okay listen, how are you gonna ask her?
That sounds perfect!
Youre gonna mess it up let me do it.
Hey!
Hey Rach!
Where are you going?
Hey, yknow what? Ill come too. Im making money now; its about time I give something back.
Okay. Have a benefit.
Thats not what she said last night. (Ross glares at him.)
Its the big night! We wanted to wish you good luck!
(behind them) Oh!! Shrimp toast! (Walks right past the little group on his way for the shrimp toast.)
Hey!
I won! That was my guess!
I guessed 20,000!
What?! I dont have 20,000!
I didnt know it was an auction!
I figured, take a guess, help a charity, free boat!
I dont know! Charity?
Oh hi!
Just out of curiosity, how-how much is that boat worth?
(To Rachel) Hey, I was pretty close. (She just glares at him.) Uhh, so bad news. Umm, I cant buy the boat, I dont have any money.
So uh listen, I think Im gonna take off now. (Starts to get up.)
Well, what am I gonna do Rach?! I dont have that kind of money!
Okay.
Look, I dont know why the kids need a youth center anyway! Yknow? They should just watch TV after school like I did and I turned out fine!
Rach! Rachel! Okay, the next highest bidder is at table one.
(To Phoebe) Oh and uh the guy who got the Paris trip is at table four.
Uhh, excuse me is there a Mr. Bowmont at this table?
Ahh, yes. (Pushes Rachel in front of himself so that she could do the talking.)
You-you have to pay that! Its not just a guess.
Are you kidding me?! Shes gonna this boat!
Aw-awww!
Oooooh
No way! Its mine!!
All that stuff you just said? I want that!
Who cares?! I-Ill make payments, whatever it takes, I want the Mr. Bowmont!!
Oh my God, youre back!
Yeah.
What?! Noooo (Phoebe gasps.)
We didnt ruin it!
Glove salesman!
Hey, being you is finally gonna pay off! (They give each other fives.)
That guys still doing that?!
Yeah! And also, a little like a French guy. (They both squint at each other.) I never noticed that before.
Hey!
(laughs) Yeah, Big Brother.
(all excited) The Mr. Bowmonts here!!! (Jumps over the back off the couch and runs out into the street.)
Hey uh, have you guys scene Chandler?
Hey Monica!
This is for my boat, pretty cool huh?
Whoa-whoa, whats the matter?! Talk to the captain!
Chandler giving you a hard time huh?
Well, you know Chandler.
Maybe you changed?
Maybe thats the problem.
Chandler is a complex fellow, one who is unlikely to take a wife.
I dont know! (All excited) I havent totally decided how to talk on my boat yet.
Monica face it, Chandler is against marriage. And-and always will be!
There are?
R-R-Richard said he wants to marry you?! (Monica nods yes.) And-and Chandlers tellin ya how much he hates marriage?!
Chandler loves marriage!!
You got that from what I said?!
Where the hell have you been?!
Richard told Monica he wants to marry her!
Yeah! Yeah, Ive been trying to find ya to tell to stop messing with her and maybe I would have if these (lifts a leg) damn boat shoes wouldnt keep flying off!
I know! They suck!!
I know!
Look, Chandler I dont think us getting our asses kicked is a solution. Okay? Just go and find Monica!
Yeah!
Okay.
Dude-dude-dude!
Let me know about that coconut phone, it might great for the boat.
(entering) Hey!
Phoebe! Were both (points at Ross and himself) your backup?!
No we werent!
Pick me!!
This is crazy! Hey look, I wanna switch to Rachel!
Okay thats fair.
Yeah.
Dude!
Shes gone.
Shes gone. She had a bag and she left.
She was all crying. She-she said you guys want different things, and that and that she needed time to think.
I-I did! I told her everything, Chandler! But she wouldnt believe me.
To her parents I think and she said you shouldnt call her. But if I were you I would.
I am so sorry man.
(yelling through the door) Can we come it yet?! Were dying out here!
Yeah!
(grabbing the candy bar) Yeah Ill take that.
Yeah, shes been out there for twenty minutes, Im surprised you didnt hear her on the way over.

(gasps) Im 30!

Well, the duck
Uh, well he did not get sick somewhere in there and it was immediately found and properly cleaned up!

Yes it is perfectly good, and it is not one of the places the duck got sick!
All right, Im gonna go! (Gets up and heads for the door.)

Hey little buddy, how are you feeling? (The duck does not get sick and Joey recoils in horror and heads for the couch.) What the hell is in that face cream? (Hes about to try out the couch but notices the bed in Rachels room. He walks into her room and feels the bed.) Thats so soft. (He pulls back the comforter.) Pillowcases! (He climbs in and groans in delight. Suddenly, he feels something under him and pulls out a little beat up paperback book. He opens it and starts to read from it.) (In his head.) Zelda looked at the chimney sweep. Her father, the vicar(Stops reading and thinks.) The vicar? (Continues reading) wouldnt be home for hours. Her loins were burning. She threw caution to the wind and reached out and grabbed his(Out loud.) Whoa! (Reads on in silence.) Whoa-ho-ho-ho! This is a dirty book! (Continues to read.)
Sweepin. Why? Turn you on?
Huh. What if I was sweeping a chimney?
Where are you going? The vicar wont be home for hours.
Where do you think, (pause) Zelda?
Yeah I did!

You got porn!
Hey Rach.

The vicar!

(nervously backing away) I-I-I-I did? (He puts a stool in front of her.)
This body? (He backs into the kitchen.)

Feminine.
