Uh-huh. (Phoebe grunts.)
Well, Im-Im just glad I could, yknow, help you out.
Hero, I uh, I dont knowwell, all right.
Oh please! (He sits down.) (To Phoebe) Youre gonna say things now, arent ya?
Hey! Oh listen, I was just clearing some space for your stuff.
What do you mean, theyre not moving in? They-theyre still moving in right?
What?! Over a stupid room!
Oh no, yeah no, that parts great!
Whats all this about you guys fighting?! Is this really over a room?! I mean, that is so silly!
Well, apparently not, and I cant just stand by and watch two people I care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. I mean, enough of the silliness!

(stopping them) Okay-okay! Two very good points, look Ive known you both a long time, and Ive never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as youve been since youve got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?
Okay! All right! Now, Chandler you-you wanna live with Monica, right?
And Mon, you wanna live with Chandler, dont ya?
(jumping up) Good! A verbal contract is binding in the state of New York! (Storms out.)
(entering) Hey Rach!
Youre never gonna believe it uh, Monica and Chandler are moving in again. Thats great news rightI mean for them. Right?
Yeah but, on the bright side, we get to be roommates again.
Wh-why?! Why-why-why would it, why would it be weird?
No!
No! No! It would be weird if we were still in that place, I mean are you still in that place?
Good! Me neither! So its not a problem. Were just two friends who happen to be roommates.
Really?! We are?
Ohh! That would be great.
(laughs as well, but for a different reason) Yeah, I didnt think of that.
So are you sure about this whole moving in thing?! I mean its a really big step! And-and whats the rush?!
No, I-I-Im serious, okay? I mean, think about it. You move in, you start fighting over stupid game rooms, next thing yknow you break up!
Okay, there are no stupid fights!! This isnt about the room, this is about what the roomrepresents! And unfortunately, this room (Points to Rachels room) could destroy you!!

Fine! Its your life! (Starts to storm out mad about his failed attempt at the manipulation of his best friend and sister, but stops and tries one last time.) I just dont want to see you guys break up! Which you will do if you move in together, (Monica and Chandler just stare at him.) but thats what you want, theres nothing I can do. (Opens the door and tries one more time.) DONT DO IT!!!!! (Finally leaves.)
(To Rachel) So umm, where are the other guys?
Fighting?!
Yeah. Theres no breaking them up, is there?
Sure! Here. (Hands her his keys.)
Yeah, Im-Im sure. (Deadpan) Yeah, get out of here before I change my mind. (She exits)
Ive been back and forth.
Ehh, I dont, I dont think so. Shes already talked about yknow, dating other guys.
Yeah, well, m-maybe youre right.
Is that what I want?
Whoa! Whoa! Whoa, Joey!
How weird is that? Yknow? Youre moving in with me and have the one thing I dont have. Its like uh, in a way you-you complete me (Phoebe glares at him) kitchen.
(in an Australian accent) You complete me kitchen, matey!
What?
OhmyGod! I-I see what this is! You are in love with Rachel!

Of course! It all adds up! I mean you youre obsessed with her. Its always, "Ross, what are you gonna do about Rachel?" "Ross, why-why are you moving in with Rachel?" "When are you gonna confess your secret marriage to Rachel?" You want her!
(answering it) Uh-oh, saved by the bell. (On phone) Hello?
(on phone) No-no-no, thats great! Ill be there Monday. And thank you again! (Listens) Okay. (Hangs up) (To All) Umm, that was the head of the Paleontology department at N uh, Y, uh U!
Well remember that paper I had published last year on sediment flow rate, huh? They loved it.

I know! Anyway, they asked me to be a guest lecturer! I mean its temporary, but uh, if they like me it could lead to a full time job. How great would that look great on a mailbox, huh? "Professor Geller."
(entering) Hey everyone!
Hey uh, well, todays my first lecture and I kinda wanted to try it out on you guys, do you, do you mind?

(he starts reading directly from his cards word for word very quietly) There are three primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. Each of these theories can be further subcategorized into two distinct"
(continuing) subcategories. The first of these subcategories is"
No! Why?

Ohh! Okay! Okay. (Resumes reading word for word from the card) There are three (pauses and looks at Joey) primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. (Pauses and darts his eyes between Chandler and Rachel.) (Rachel starts laughing) Each of these theories (glances at Phoebe) can be further subcategorized (glances at Chandler) into"
Open with a joke? Its a university, not a comedy club!
(gets up) Okay!
Thank you!
Please dont say naked chicks.
I-I-I dont even know why I bother to talk to you guys about it. Yknow what? Im just gonna do it on my own with no naked chicks.
(entering) Hello!
It went great! And I didnt need any jokes or naked chicks either!
I knew all I had to do was let the material speak for itself. Everyones all, "Ross you have to be funny and sexy." Well, I proved them wrong! And now, Im gonna pass the news onto Joey and Chandler.
Thats right!

(to the class) Right! So when Rigby got his samples back from the laboratory he made a startling discovery! What he believed to be igneous, was in fact sedimentary. Imagine his consternation when(sees Monica and Rachel.) Oh bloody hell.
Look, I was nervous! You guys had me all worried I was going to be boring! I got up there and they were all like staring at me. I opened my mouth and this British accent just came out.
Will you-will you please?
Oh.
(in his British accent) Im sorry, Ive got plans with my sister.
(in accent) Right, will you excuse us for one moment? (Takes Monica aside.) (In his normal voice.) What are you doing?
Just please stop!
(entering) Look, I really need some help, okay? Why? Why did I have to speak in a British accent?! What do I do?
Theyre not listening too me?
Monica you really think I should try this phasing out thing?

(in his head) All right, keep going. We are phasing the accent out, phasing it out. So without out re-testing the results in the laboratory (pronounced the British way) the team would never have identified (British) the initial errors in their carbon dating analysis (British). Were there any questions at this point? (One student raises his hand.) Yes. (Points to him.)

(British) Come again? Whats-whats this nonsense? (Giggles.) (American.) All right, Im-Im not English. Im from Long Island. I was really nervous and the accent just uh, just came out. Im sorry. So, if we could just get back to the lecture. Umm, were there any questions? (Everyone raises their hands) About paleontology. (They all put their hands down.) All right, look I was just trying to make a good first impression. Obviously, I screwed up. But what you guys think of me is really important because Im-Im hoping to get a permanent job here. So if you just give me another chance to make a good impression
(in the accent again) Well, hello Rachel!
Look I was going to tell you!
Okay, maybe it wasnt my best decision. But I just couldnt face another failed marriage.
Rach, come on, if you think about it, its actually kinda funny. (He laughs, and he laughs alone.) Okay, maybe its best not to think about it.
Phoebe, I told her you already knew.
Okay, I got us a court date for tomorrow at 2:00 and I picked up all the forms. Ill take care of everything.
Okay Rach, but
Look I told you
Look, if youd had two failed marriages, youd understand!
What about the time I said we were on a break?
Fine, Im mentally unstable.
What?!
Crack isnt even an intravenous drug!
Oh, come on!

Okay, Im sorry, this is insane! I-I-Im not addicted to heroin, Im not gay, and there is no problem with my ability to consummate anything! Look, Ill consummate this marriage right here, right now!
And when we were dating we consummated like bunnies!

Well, of course you can defend yourself from an attack you know is coming, thats not enough. Look, I studying kara-tay for a long time, and theres a concept you should really be familiar with. Its what the Japanese call (he holds two fingers up to his temple, and he does this every time he says this word) unagi.
No, its a concept!
All right, maybe it means that too
Yknow what? Fine! Get attacked! I dont even care!
Unagi is a state of total awareness. Okay? Only by achieving true unagi can you be prepared for any danger that may befall you!

(moves closer) All Im saying is, its one thing being prepared for an attack against like each other; whole another story being prepared for an attack, I dont know, like a (turns and puts his face close to Rachels and screams) surprise!!
All right, you know that one was coming, but that doesnt mean you have unagi. (Does the finger thing.)
Yknow what (Moves away as Chandler enters, panicked.)
No.
So what are you gonna do?
DANGER!!! DANGER!!!!!
A lesson in the importance of unagi. (He starts doing the finger thing every time now.)
Perhaps. Now Im curious, at what point during those girlish screams would you have begun to kick my ass?

Im sorry I had to take such drastic measures to make my point, but Ilook, I just want you guys to be safe. (Monica comes out to throw out the garbage and Ross screams) DANGER!!!!! (She completely ignores him and keeps walking.) Ahhh, huh? Unagi.
(not turning around) Chandler. I sensed it was you.
Unagi. Im always aware.
Whats up?
Oh, why dont you make her one of your little jokes.
Yknow what? Shed-shed love this. (Picks up a model of the Saturn V rocket, thats the one that took man to the moon.) Uh, its an exact replica of Apollo 8. I made it in the sixth grade.

Yeah-yeah, except Apollo 8 didnt actually land on the moon. But you-you-you could write that umm, your love lets me orbit the moon twice and return safely. (Apollo 8 was the first one that orbited the moon and the one that read the Christmas Story from the orbit of the moon on Christmas Eve, 1968. They also took the famous Earthrise picture of the Earth rising over the moon.)
Why not?
Oh.
Its not something you are! Its something you have!
Yknow what? I can easily get out of this, but there is a chance you can get very, very hurt!
Its a great class.

Yeah, yeah, I was watching. (The instructor just nods and walks away.) Umm, hey, a couple of questions though. Umm, about that-that-that last move where the woman tripped you and then pinned you to the floor, what-what-what-what would you do next?
No. No-no. No. What would you do next?
Yes thats right.
I tired attacking two women, did not work.
No, I mean its okay, I mean, theyre-theyre my friends. In fact, I-I-I was married to one of them.
Oh, no! No-no! No, I tired! But I couldnt. Thats why Im here. Maybe we could attack them together? (He glares at him.) That-thats a no.
Ah-ha, nowhere to run! (He starts to run towards them.)
DANGER!!!!

Hey! I just got uh, my teacher evaluations! Check out what this one student wrote, "I loved Dr. Gellers class. Mind blowing lectures! Dr. Geller, you are definitely the hottie of the paleontology department!"
Oh, I wish I knew, but the evaluations are all anonymous.
Yeah.
Its a girl! Anyway, it wouit wouldnt matter. Okay? Because Im a teacher and shes a student.
No, but it is frowned upon.
Besides, theres a big age difference.
I know when Im 90 shell be like 80 and it wont seem like such a big difference.
(startled) Yeah?
Oh thank you. Thanks very much. (Leans up against the board and on a thumbtack.) Ow! (He pulls away.)
That was you?
Oh I, I dont-I dont think that would be the best idea.
What time?
Gotcha. (Starts to leave.)
Oh! So-so seriously, what time?
What? Of course I did! You uh, you sat next to Sleepy Sleeperson.
Oh uh, I had trouble remembering everyones name, so I-I kinda came up with nicknames. Like the guy on the other side of you was Smelly von Brownshirt.
Umm, no. No.
Umm, its Cutie McPretty.

Listen, I gotta tell ya, I-Im having a great time! Yknow how before you said it might be weird, the whole student teacher thing, and to be frank I thought it would be too, but its not. I mean its not at all.
(pushing Elizabeth into a doorway) Burt!

We had such a great time! Shes-shes incredible! I thought the-the age difference might be a problem, but it wasnt. It wasnt at all. Elizabeth is very mature for her age. (Joey makes the international sign for big boobies.) (To Monica) A concept lost on some people!
Well, not really. I mean technically its-its not against the rules or anything, but it is frowned upon. Especially by that professor we ran into last night, Judgey von Holierthanthou.
Yeah. What-what should I do?
Going out with who?
Oh yeah! Wasnt she uh (Does the international sign for big boobies.)
What do you want to do now? Huh? You wanna go get a drink?
Oh, you have some studying to do?
Yknow I remember when uh, when I was in college, we used to (He sees some of his colleagues enter and puts his head on her lap.)
Nothing, Im-Im just, Im so comfortable with you!
What? No! Of course, of course I do! Are-are they gone?

What?! No! No! Wait! Youre right, this is stupid. Who cares what people think? I mean, I mean we like each other right? Theres nothing wrong with that. Come on. (They get up and go over to the table where his colleagues are sitting.) Burt? Lydia? Mel? This is Elizabeth.
Thats right Lydia, Elizabeth here is a student and uh, were dating. And you may frown upon that, but were not gonna hide it anymore.
What?
Really? Its not just frowned upon?
Wow! It actually is in the handbook. I cant date you or have a hot plate in my office. I cant believe we have to stop seeing each other.
I know, I know I really like you too. But we-we cant date. Its against the rules. Its forbidden.
What?
Really?
Well I-I-I dont care how hot it is its-its uh, its wrong.
(feeling it too) No! No! Its wrong! Its-its-its naughty. Its taboo.
Lets also get a hot plate!
Hey everybody!
Hey uh, this is Elizabeth.
Oh no-no-no, were just two people who happen to run into each other here at the coffee house. (He winks at her.)
Bye.
Oh that is quite all right maam. (Elizabeth exits.)
Yes, her molecular epidemiology paper is due tomorrow.
Anyone else? Huh? Bring em on!
I dont know Rachel, why?
Well thanks!
Well, actually its been great. Shes 20 so shes not looking for anything too serious, which is perfect for me right now.
Thanks. I know you guys like to give me a hard time and all, but it really means a lot to me that you like her. Just knowing that you guys are
Hmm? (Turns around and sees that its Elizabeth) Oh, a student I dont know.
Yes, yes of course, what-what would this be regarding?
Shh! (Laughs then composes himself) Of course, why dont we go inside?
Oh-ooh!
Doorknob! Doorknob!
Oh, okay. What-what about?
Spring vacation.

(quickly jumping away from Elizabeth) Yes, professor Feesen-sen-stenlger Ill be with you in one moment. (To Elizabeth) So, I will take one box of the Thin Mints. (And he ushers Elizabeth out of the office.)
You dont understand! Elizabeth was about to ask me to go on a trip with her! Is that taking it slow?! No, Im not ready for this! Okay? What-what do I tell her?
I can do that. Oh-oh, what if she gets upset?
What the hell are you doing?
What?! What? How do you, how do you even know its broken?!
Joey, I did not break this! Okay? (He opens the freezer and smells inside and recoils in disgust.) That has been broken for a while.
Do not give him any money!
Yes. Yes! Please, come in.
Oo-oo!
Yeah, it kinda grows on you. (They both laugh.) Actually, I wanted to finish talking to you about uh, spring vacation.

Look, I (He has trouble sitting in his chair.) Look, Im having a great time with you and I just dont want us to move to fast or put to much pressure on us. So, Im sorry I just dont think we should go away together yet. Its-its too soon.
No. I think you misunderstood what I was saying. What I meant was
That! Lets talk about that.
Hey!
Huh? Oh-oh, it was fine. Uh, it was just a misunderstanding. She didnt want me to go with her. She just wanted to let me know that shes going to Florida for spring vacation.
Whats-whats the difference?
Hey, yknow what? Not all spring breaks are like that.
I went to Egypt with my dad.
Hey, I think Elizabeth is a little more serious than, "Spring break!" (Imitates the party noise.) All right? I mean shes taken my class!
Im gonna call her.

Well, it turns out that she is going to Daytona for spring break woo-hoo. That means, that means wet T-shirt contests, guys doing shots off of girls bodies, waking up next to people you dont even know
Okay, she cant go.
Then what am I supposed to do?
Well, what is she goes down and-and sleeps with a bunch of guys?
Im so glad youre going on this trip!
Sure. Sure. Look I dont, I dont know if your plans are finalized yet, but umm, hey I-I know another great way to blow off steam.
Are you into crafts at all?

Well, yeah, of-of course Im okay! What? Im just being supportive. Supportive of you and this whole trip, and-and (notices something) what-what is uh, whats this? (He holds up a rather skimpy bathing suit.)
To wear in front of people?
Is this?!
So uh, have a great time down there.
Yeah. And did you, did you pack that bathing suit?

It was pretty funny when I, when I hid it for a while, huh? Anyway, umm, I-I am worried about that bathing suit, not because its revealing which Im fine with, no Im concerned about your health, sun exposure.
Well, if whats in the bottle is actually 30. I mean sometimes you get 30, sometimes its-its get 4, and I swear to God more often than not its just milk.
Really?
Okay. Cool.
Call me!
Excuse me?
So you gonna invite us all to the big opening?
Its your turn.
Wait a minute, are you doing that thing where you pretend it didnt go well but it really did go well?
Totally!
Great!
Wow!
Oh, I love that guy! (Laughs.)
(stops laughing) What am I doing?
Look, dont worry. Okay? Youre gonna be fine.
Yeah, none of us have to deal with pressure at our jobs.
Oh my God!
You ate my sandwich?
(getting upset) Oh-oh really?
(jumping to his feet in anger) What?
You-you-you-you (trying to remain in control) threw my sandwich away!
(losing control, we hear him shout outside) MY SANDWICH?!!!
MY SANDWICH!!!!!! (Ross's scream scares a flight of pigeons away.)
What?
What?
Yes, yes it is. In prison!
It took two people to break up this relationship!!
I didnt know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didnt finish the whole letter!
I fell asleep!

It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! (they go into the living room, trapping Monica, Chandler, and Joey in the kitchen) (to Rachel) Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means you are, Y-O-U-R means your!
(starts to cry) FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind it)
Thatll be a neat trick, when youre, (looks at the script) when youre dead!
There was just an explosion, okay? My hearing would be impaired.
Thank you! And I have to say that first scene when you meet Mac
Oh my God. I mean
Totally.
(entering) Hey!
What are you guys doing later?
(continuing) I just found out that Elizabeths dad wants to meet me.
Come on guys, I-I really want this guy to like me. It-it would really help me out if you guys were here to make me look good.
Thanks!
It-its great to meet you Paul.
Of course, of course, Mr. Stevens.
Eh-whExcuse me?
Thats funny. Umm. (Pause, then serious) Its not funny.
Okay. I can, I can see that. Umm, but I think if you give me umm, one chance I can, I can change your mind.
What?
This isyou(Ross starts laughing.)

Okay, umm I want you to know that I have never done anything like this before. I mean, I mean Ive been in um, relationships in general, uh but I have never done it with a studentI mean I notnot it! I mean, I mean I dontWe havent done it. Uh, I mean, I mean, weve-weve-weve done stuff. (Paul is not amused.) Okay, okay, a joke, a jokelighten the mood. Umm, two guys go into a bar. One of them is Irish.
And the Irish guy wins the joke!
Oh God, thank you! (Runs and gives all of them a group hug.) Umm, uh, Mr. Stevens Id like you to meet my friends uh, this is Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler.

Okay umm, why dont we all take a seat, yknow? And uh, and Ill get us all some uh some coffees(He goes to pull out Elizabeths chair, but Paul steps in)Yeah, why dont you. (Paul pulls out her chair) Uh and you guys can talk about whatever, whatever you want. Yknow? Whatever pops into your head. (He turns his back to Paul and Elizabeth and points to himself for Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe. Then he goes to order the coffee.)
(returning with the coffee) Okay here we are Paul, Elizabeth. (He sets down their cups.) So I hope you guys were finding something to talk about.
Joey?!
Joey?! Joey!! (He runs into his bedroom.)
Okay, Ill just wait for him in here!
(coming out of the bedroom) Oh! Oh my God! I didnt even see you!
What-what-what thehow da-how did-what the-how did-what?!
(incredulous) In your mouth?!
You were at the coffeehouse!
He is my girlfriends father, okay? Its-its, its weird!
That was different!
This is weird for me!
How is that important?
Yeah, take your time.
(to Paul) Just-just so you know I was a freshman and she was a senior. So it wasnt as bad as-as
Not all bad.
Yeah. You know what? I know what you mean; I do that too.
No! No! NotI dont mean I-I see her as a twelve-year-old girl! I mean I-I have a son, whos umm six and I still think of him as a baby.

Yeah, well my-my ex-wife and I share custody of Ben and umm, uh, and just so you know, Carol and I are on excellent terms as Im sure you are with your wife! (Realizes) Oh, Im sorry! (To Elizabeth) Its unbelievable!
Youre back.
Yknow what? I-I-I I-I have had enough of this! Yknow, I-I-I care a great deal about your daughter and I have treated her with nothing but respect! So if-if youve got a problem with me, frankly
God no!
Well if it doesnt matter to her, it doesnt matter to me! (to Paul) Still not yelling!
Thats okay, Im not so crazy about myself right now either.
Uh yeah, I guessYeah! I guess so.
Ohhh! Kids!
Thats okay Rach, were not liking Ross right now.
(entering) Hey!
Thanks? But I have plans; Elizabeth and I are going out of town.
Yeah.
Why? What?

No, no, thats funny. But maybe its time to move on, let it go, yknow? Stop it! Besides, Rachel is going out with Elizabeths father, so ah, hes much older than she is. Looks like Im not the only one interested in fossils, huh?
Okay, okay. Uh, well uh, Rachel is going to need to yell sweet nothings (Paul enters) in his ear.
Oh, come on you guys; thats funny! Yknow? Because hes needhes got like a hearing aide yknow, cause-cause yknow, cause hes all old, and
Really? That okay, thats great.
All right look, I-I realize it upsets you.
But, Elizabeth and I are-are both adults and so I dont think theres really anything you can do about it.
Ohh! A man with a plan!
This place is really beautiful!
Wow! The only thing I got from my Grandmother was her eyes. I mean not-not her actual eyeballs, but, but people say that my eyesDo-do you want to make out?
Ehh, I was just, I was just thinking about your father.
No. No-no uh, he just, he just really freaked me out before.
Yeah.

(loudly) Why?! Are there like bears or something?! (Looks around and then sees that Elizabeth is shaking her head no and realizes what Elizabeth meant.) Ohh. Oh, protection. Yeah-no, yeah-no, that-that-that I forgot.
Oh no! Hey-hey, Im the guy! Ill get it.
No.
A little bit.
Okay.
Ohh, okay.
What are you doing here?!
Yeah, I recognize the ankles!
(under the couch) You and your ice.
(before entering) Did you really hear a bear?

Elizabeth! (He opens one of the bed stands that he has curled himself up into.) Okay. Okay. (She helps him out.) Im gonna go out this window. (Points to the window next to him.) Ill meet you at the front door. Just tell them youre going home, okay?
(to Elizabeth) And that is why we cannot see each other anymore.
Okay, please-please Paul, just let me explain
All right, fine! Fine! Have me fired! But uh, I want you to know that you and I are not all that different. I mean, I too am a neat guy. (Paul just looks at him.)
And I too am just a love machine. (Hums a little bit and mimics Pauls flexing.)
Oh perfect, we were just gonna see if you wanted to go.
How rude.
Hi!
Great to see you!
How you doing?
Okay! You take care!
Hey Pheebs, what-what was the deal with you and Chandler blowing us off before?
Phoebe, whyd you do it?
What?! Why?!
I cant think of anything.
Wait a minute, is it because Joey and I didnt invite him to that Knicks game a couple of weeks ago?
I guess it could.
Well, if hes angry, he really shouldnt just cover it up. I-I wish he would just tell me the truth.
Hey, remember how Chandler and Phoebe blew us off yesterday?
Remember? You-you were eating pizza.
Okay. Well, apparently Chandlers angry at us for not getting him a ticket to that Knicks game a couple of weeks ago.
Yeah! Anyway, I-I still think we should try to patch things up, yknow? Like uh, maybe we could get him to get tickets to another Knicks game and invite him.
Oh. (Starts to get his money)
All the time?
Hey! So uh, was he excited about the tickets?
What?!
I cant believe it. (Pause) Can I tell you something? Im a little mad at him now.
Yknow what? He didnt want to talk to us about being angry, well maybe we dont talk to him at all!
Thats right!
Eh? Well show him!
Wait a minute, is this, is this for real?
So you two are really serious?!
You-youre gonna get married?! I mean Were gonna be brothers-in-law! (They hug.)
Hey-hey Pheebs!
Chandlers gonna ask Monica to marry him!
You told her before you told us?
God that is the most beautiful engagement ring ever!
Yeah, you didnt get one.
Hey!
(entering) Hey!
Oh no, I have plans with Elizabeth.
Im sorry, its just one of my last nights together before she leaves for campto be a counselor!
I dont know.
Wait a minute, does-does everyone feel this way?

Uh-uhWow! Uh, I thought you guys were just like making jokes, I had no idea. What you know what? You guys are wrong. Uh yes, there is a chronological age difference but I never notice it. You know why? Because she is very mature. Besides, it doesnt really matter to me what you guys think. I mean, Im the one dating Elizabeth, not you!
Yeah, yeah you have the ring?
(to the rest of them) Yeah-yeah you guys. Get out of here!
Whats-whats going on?
Oh, you have to call the police! Thats what I did to the kids in my building!
Oh! (Does a laugh/groan.) Listen umm, I, I just stopped by to see if you wanted to see this play tonight. Umm, its supposed to be excellent. The director is the same
No! Okay! Okay! (Stops her.) Okay, look, can I, can I just-just talk to you for a second?
Uh, so this play umm, what do you think? Its-its gotten great reviews! Yknow the uh
(screaming) Everybody put their balloons down!!! (There is a temporary cease fire.) Now this is a nice suit!! (Shows everyone where he was hit.)
Oh my God, you guys!! (Hes excited about what he thought happened.)
Who?
What? (Excited) A-ohh! (Realizes) Ohh. Oh thats right thats right. Thats Richards favorite place too.
Yeah, I was but uh, she was a little busy with a water balloon fight.

Yknow, maybe she is too young for me. Yknow, when I was over there and she was running around with her friends, I felt like I was a baby-sitter. I finally started to see what you guys were talking about. I dont know what to do.
Okay umm, bad stuff. Well, Im-Im 12 years older than she is.
Hmm.
Okay, good stuff. Umm, well shes-shes sweet and pretty and
No! No! Ididnt do that. Its just Okay, honestly no. I dont, I dont see a big future with her.
Ive got to talk to her. Ugh, I hate this part.
(in his head) Wow! I have never had such a healthy break-up! She was such a grown-up about it! She didnt seem too immature for me! Did I just make a huge mistake?
Elizabeth, thank God! I was just thinking about
What?!
Okay, break-ups still on!
What happened you guys?
Rach!
Hey, come on in.
Oh, thanks. Yeah, I really thought wed be able to make it work, but uh, I guess it just wasnt meant to be.
I guess so.
Right. Ohh! You-you want me to be your backup.
Ohh, yeah I already have one.
Phoebe.
Ohh, I dont think so.
Thats impossible! I mean we have had a deal for years! We-we-we shook on it, although believe me she wanted to do a lot more than that.
(entering) Hey!
Phoebe, how could you do this to me?!
I was not!
No! Pick me! I dont want to end up an old maid!
Ooh, I wanna switch to Rachel too!
All right.
Hey, whats going on?
I found a note on my door, "Come to Monicas quick, bring champagne and a Three Musketeers bar."
Whats up?
Oh my God. (Hugs Chandler.) Congratulations.
Where is she?
Oh, I thought it was just a kid yelling, "Im gay! Im gay!" Can I bring her in?
Hey!
Wow! Happy Monicas night!
Thanks.
Well sure. But I get married all the time so
You okay?
You mean, weyou and me?
Oh good, you scared me for a minute.
I meanno, its just cause, its just cause you and I were like a nightmare. (Screams.) No, but there was some good times.
Surely you can think of something good.
What?
Yeah? I was good at the stuff huh?
My hands?
Yeah?
(to his hands) Way to go guys. Yknow, you-you were really good at the stuff too.
A what?
One night, just-just sex. No strings attached?
No.
Okay, this is getting a little crazy. I mean, Im-Im sure it would be amazing but Igotta say I really-really dont think it would be a good idea. Yknow? I really, reallydont.
Okay, Monica. Mon, uh what-what you just saw
It is! It is!
Okay! Ho-ho! We did not steal your thunder because we are not getting back together!
Yeah!
It was just a kiss. (Phoebe enters and overhears this.)
Look lets not make a big deal out of this! It was a one time thing. It doesnt even matter!
Oh no!
And; people thinking its huge has led Monica to believe that we are stealing her thunder. (To Monica) Which we are not!
Guess who? (Enters fully.)
Hey, I just realized we kinda let some stuff up in the air
Still thinking about it huh?
(loosening his tie) Oh, who cares?
(tightening his tie) And so do I.
Okay. Sure. (Sits down on her bed.)
(sitting up) No! (Exits.)
(To Rachel) Hey, heres a thought.
Got me. (He shows of his hands.)
Uh, Rachel, Ive been thinking. I dont think us getting together tonight is such a good idea. Im calling it off.
Look uh, if were gonna do this
Oh, I see, so everybody wins.
Oww!
(deadpan) Well, Im going to take off. (To Chandler) Congratulations man.
(at the door) And uh, Rachel.
What can I say, you missed your chance. From now on the only person whos going to enjoy these bad boys (holds up his hands) is me. (Quickly realizes what he said and exits disgustedly.)
Hi!
Oh, Ill have some!
Take from me, as the groom all you have to do is show up and try to say the right name.

And that should conclusively prove that I had the idea for Jurassic Park first! Now lets take a look at (Phoebe rushes in.)
Phoebe, oh my God! Wh-wh-what are you doing here?

Oh my God! Of course, of course. (To the class.) Umm, would you please excuse me for a moment? Umm, do you know each others hometowns? Why dont you (Motions that they should learn everyones hometown.) (To Phoebe) Wh-whats going on?
Umm, okay, yeah, sure. But wh-whats wrong with Monica and Chandler?
Phoebe, you said it was urgent!
Do you realize I have a classroom full of students?
Uh, Phoebe
Phoebe, what are you doing?
Phoebe!
Phoebe, you cant massage people in my apartment!
And they knew about it?
Look, this is my home and I want to be able to come and go whenever I want!
The big deal is I dont want naked, greasy strangers in my apartment when I want to kick back with a puzzlebeer! Cold beer.
Hello.
Uh no-no, she-shes out for the night.
Can I, can I help you with something?
(deadpan) Yes I am.
Okay! Now, Im going to touch you. (He does so, very gingerly.) Ohh, thats soft. (He starts poking him and notices his salad spoons and starts to massage him with those.)
(sitting down) Hey, what are you guys, what are you guys talking about?
(takes a drink) Damn, this coffees cold! Hey Rach, do you mind if I heat this up on your loins? (Joey and he both laugh.)
So I guess you bought that book after we broke up huh?
(chases her) Oh yeah, yeah? Well uh, when we were going out, I read tons of porno magazines! (Realizes a table of women overheard him.) (To that table.) Sup?
(looking at the table) Excuse me ladies. (To Phoebe) Im sorry?
(incredulous) I gave him an extremely professional massage!
Okay, so it wasnt uh, a traditional massage. But I did give him accu-pressure with a pair of chopsticks. And, and I gently exfoliated him with, with a mop.
Hey, yknow what? This is your fault! Youre the one that didnt move his-his appointment.
He said he liked that!! Oh youre right, youre right. Im sorry.
His daughter was hot.
About what?
Well, you-youve always had glasses.
Are you sure?
(entering from the bathrooms) Hey Chandler, what are you doing tonight?
No, why?

Well

Married couples send out cards, families send out cards, people who have been dating for a couple of months do not send out cards! What-what is she crazy?!

Sending out a holiday card, together, I mean I just dont know if were really quite there yet.

Hmm

The card! I think were there!

I know! I know! Why do you guys need to have this conversation?! Huh? I mean no self-respecting man would ask a woman, "So, where is this going?"

Hey! You were a closed book! Okay? Im not a mind reader! Besides, I hate those conversations. Im horrible at them. Really! Maybe-maybe I need kind of a gesture. Yknow, something that says were moving forward without having to talk about it.
Smaller than that.
Uh, bigger than that.

Here we go. Mona umm, I think its time we-we had a conversation about-about where things are with us.

Aw, we-we are so(Motions that theyre connected.) So umm, well I-I-I like you and I-I love umm, yknow hanging out with you. And I mean-Im having a lot of fun. (He pauses and thinks there might be more, but decides there isnt.)

I mean, theres no point in spending time with someone if-if its just fun. Its gotta be, its gotta be going somewhere right? So where-where is it going? (Pause) Ah! Thats-thats the real question. And-and the answer isis its going somewherefun. Now I-I know what youre thinking, fun was fine for you like ten years ago yknow, but youre-youre not getting any younger. No I meanNo not you, not you, youyou are getting younger. I meanyou-you look like youre getting younger by the secondWhats your secret?
Well, well to sum up, were having fun, you look young.
Really.
Not just a key, I gave her the only key! I am now a homeless person in a very serious relationship.

Okay, and oh Im gonna need a bunch of extra keys. Apparently I give them away for no reason at all.

Im trying to tell you I made you a mix tape.
I love you!

Professor Neuman, the head of the department, so.

which brings us back, of course, to Greelys theory of dominance. (The bell rings.) Okay, that-thats all for today. Oh, uh does anyone know where the Freeman building is?

No, I ran. It was really far, and when did people stop understanding the phrase, "Get the hell out of my way!"
Ugh, between the traffic that time of day and all the one-way streets itll take me twice as long. Besides, I teach the class three times a week, who am I? Rockefeller?
Well I have to. Okay? If I dont, theyll take the class away from me. AndI already put it in my family newsletter.

Besides, I-I think I figured out a much faster route, Im sure I can make it this time. I justI just cant be afraid to get a little bithit by cars. (He goes to the bathroom as Joey enters.)

Yeah!!!! Yes, I made it! Im on time! (Grabs a bottle of water from a student, takes a drink, and splashes some on his face like the marathon runners do.) With an aptitude for science.

I dont think so! Youre just giving me Ruth so youll get to name it when its a boy, and thats when youll swoop in and name him Heath or Blaine or Sequoia.

(with his mouth full) Just a second! (he fake laughs, but turns his head and starts to break down)

Well, Im, uh, going to pick up Mona. What have you got going tonight?

(fakes a laugh) Please start drinking! (exits)
(handing Mona the present) Happy Valentines Day! Or something to remember me by.Scene: Monica and Chandlers. Monica and Chandler are sitting on the couch still staring at the screen.

Yeah. Wait a minute. What are you doing here? Joey Tribbiani without a date on Valentines Day? Whats going on, huh? Girl trouble?
Really?!
Oh, sorry. Well, look, maybe I can help you with it.
Hey, whatever it is, I am sure it has happened to me. Yknow, actually onceonce I got dumped during sex. (Two girls sitting at a table next to them look up in disgust, and Ross and Joey move away)
Anyway, so, uh, so what is it?
Cmon! Joey! What is it?
Hey, hey, its me. Why cant you tell me?
Shes not a Tribbiani?

Okay. Um is he a good guy?

Okay, Joey, you know what? You have to go for it. How often does this happen to you, huh? You owe it to yourself.
Im going touhIm going to, um, put the bourbon in it at home.
Anyway seriously, uhjustjust talk to the guy, okay? And tell me how it goes. (walks towards the door until)
(closes the door) Did you umIm sorry, did you just say its Rachel?
Um, youyou like Rachel?
Rachel?!
But R-R-Rachel-Rachel?!
Its not a big deal? Oh, Im sorry I justum, Iwhat about all the stuff you-you just said? I mean how about, I likeyou-you cant stop thinking about her. Like how you cant sleep?
Rachel whos carrying my baby? Rachel?
Yknow what? I-I gotta go. (Starts to leave.)
(stops) I justyknowI-I just have oneRachel?!
Hey.
Oh yknow, I stillI cant believe it. Joey and Rachel I mean its Its like you and me going out, only weirder!

Sure, because women never like Joey. Yknow, I think hes a virgin.
Hes not?

Hate him? I No, I dont hate him. (Pause) Its just its Rachel, yknow?
Okay. Okay, Ill talk to him.
Hey.
No, I dont want to hit you.
No.

No, no I dont want to do anything to you. All right? I just want to tell you that Im not mad at you andand that I certainly do not hate you. I just, I just came here to say that. (Starts to leave.)

Okay.
Thank you.

I think you need to tell her how you feel.
No, Im serious. You-you need to find out where she is, because if shes not where you are, then you can start to move past this.
If she is where you are then uhthen my feeling weird about it shouldnt stand in the way.
Yeah. Look if-if shes gonna end up with somebody else, the truth is she couldnt find a better guy. So
So when do you think youre gonna talk to her?
Im understanding, but lets not get carried away.

(entering) Hey! Has anyone seen my shirt? Its a button down, like a, like a faded salmon?
Faded salmon color.
Great! Great. Then I mustve left it at Monas. I knew it!

I dont know. I mean I-I guess I could. Its just that we didnt really end things such good terms. And if I go over there Id be ignoring the one thing she asked me to do when we broke up, jump up my own ass and die. (Walks away.)

Mona? (Theres no answer, so he starts to leave but remembers where her extra key is. He reaches atop a hall light just outside her door and grabs the key. Hello!!

(on phone) Item J437-A, color: winterberry. (Theres a knock on the door as he hangs up the phone. He answers it to Mona.) Hi umm, listen come here, come in. (She does so.) Im so-so sorry about yesterday. I-Im really sorry. Its just that I (He picks up the pink shirt.)
You do?
(faking starting to cry) Oh God youre right.
(laughs) No. (Takes the shirt back.)

(picking up Chi-Chis picture) Aww! Chi-Chi! Oh, I loved this dog! Yknow Monica couldnt get braces because Chi-Chi needed knee surgery.
You were the 200-pound 11-year-old who rode her!

and then, we couldve gone from the ceremony to the reception with you in the sidecar!
But having a dove place the ring on your finger wouldve been no problem?
Yeah! And! And, it was the easiest 400 bucks Ive ever made.
Yeah.

Even if the sidecar had a windscreen so your hair wouldnt get messed up?
Thats all Im askin

Hey! All that stuff you said about true love, you were right, I mean, we did learn a lot from Mom and Dad! And that picture of Chi-Chi with her mischievous grin. And what you said about Nana. Ohh, yeah she really wouldve wanted to be there. And you know what? I think she was.
Hey!
Whyd you say no?
Just then or-or all the time, cause we-we have jobs yknow.
Shhh! Were not talking.
Uh, double latte, extra foam.

(leaning into the recorder as well) Who just lost the respect of her unborn child.

All right I've been feeling incredibly guilty about this, because I wanna be a good friend, and damnit I am a good friend. So just, just shut up and close your eyes (kisses Joey).
Your make-up!

Id like to spin the wheel!

Ben Franklin.
Queen Victoria.
